title: Adding a tweakable call to action in home
label: [Label(name="home")]
body:
Adding a tweakable call to action in home that would use a file on the Open Food Facts server, and that we could update on the fly.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1689815/48661748-66b5d300-ea77-11e8-8685-fa1dbe6aa669.png)

title: New Crowdin translations
body: Enjoy!

title: Added MaterialDialog for visual feedback when clicking (Take Your Pictures).
label: [Label(name="image upload"), Label(name="product browsing")]
body:
## Description
Added MaterialDialog for visual feedback when clicking (Take Your Pictures). Changes have been in "OpenFoodAPIClient" file.
## Related issues and discussion
#1978 There is no visual feedback on uploading image using "Take more pictures"
 
 ## Screen-shots

![screenshot_2018-11-14-23-17-53-269](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32436867/48501926-6396c900-e864-11e8-8b18-1f288c9b7e5b.jpeg)

title: New Crowdin translations
body: Enjoy!

title: Errors with % in Nutrition Facts
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="nutrition facts")]
body:
Input item in database (Barcode: 0834266007424, last edit by me: 2018-11-13-03.05.00-UTC)

Errors (in "per serving" values):
Calcium: 0.15 % DV (label value is 15% DV)
Magnesium: 0.02% DV (label value is 6% DV)
Iron: 0.00% DV (label value is 8% DV)
Phosphorus: 0.15% DV (label value is 15%)

Inputting label values and "Save Edits" doesn't fix errors.

OpenFoodFacts version 2.9.7
LineageOS version 15.1
Android version 8.1.0

title: Fixed issue where nutrient units were not being converted to thecorrect units.
body:
## Description

Fixed issue where nutrient units were not being converted to the correct units.
Also fixed some errors in calculating the values in CalculateDetails activity, and refactored some code and added comments.

## Related issues and discussion
fixes #1984 

## Screenshots
For https://world-es.openfoodfacts.org/producto/8480017371676 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2354602/48305546-749cae80-e4e1-11e8-8465-1eeb8117910f.png)

title: Add Diet to OFF (WIP alpha 1)
label: [Label(name="feature"), Label(name="ingredients")]
body:
Add Diet (authorised, so-so and unauthorised ingredients) to OFF. 

## Description

The App will display authorised ingredients in green, so-so in orange, unauthaurised in red. Multi diets.
New Item Menu Your Diet(s) 
Click + to add a Diet,
Fill in the form,
Add another diet if desired then you can enable or disable a Diet.
Scan a product and take a look at the list of ingredients, your unauthorised ingredients will appear in red, the so-so ingredients in Orange and the authorised ones in Green.

 ## Screen-shots, if any

title: Show additive overexposure table even if wikidata is missing
label: [Label(name="additives")]
body:
Signed-off-by: Rares Petrescu <petrescu.rares@gmail.com>

Change the default behaviour when clicking a moderate/high additive by showing the overexposure table even if wikidata is missing.

Before this change, if the wikidata was missing, a click on the additive name will automatically search for products containing the additive.
With this patch, if wikidata is missing, we hide the description and the wiki button from additive details popup, but we still display the overexposure table and the search button.

label: [Label(name="editing")]
body: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1689815/47312860-c3bb9600-d63d-11e8-92da-f8258ab9ff61.png)

title: The scanner does not respect the language of the phone
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
The scanner does not respect the language of the phone.
If a product is available in English and Spanish, with English as the main language, but Spanish as the language of the app, the product will be displayed in English.
The app should display the product in Spanish.

title: "I logged in and I'm still under anonymous"
label: [Label(name="account management"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="login")]
body:
_Originally reported by @rbigueras as openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-server#1306_

**Summary:** 
I logged in and I'm still under anonymous 

**Steps to reproduce:** 

use the android app beta, and click on anonymous, 
the app asks to log in, 
log in
once logged in the user's name is still anonymous
and when you try to relog in, it says you already are.
**Add system logs:**

title: Fix #1889: MaterialDialogException in HistoryScanActivity.
body:
## Description

**Steps To Reproduce:**
1.  Enable "Don't keep activities" in the Developer Options.
2.  Run the app go to the History section, then switch back to another app, stay there for 15-20 seconds, then open the app from the recent.
3.  It will crash.

We need to pass the Activity instance here, not the base context. So I replace getBaseContext() with "this".

## Related issues and discussion
#1889 MaterialDialogException in HistoryScanActivity.

title: Always a network error is displayed in case of any errors in editing a product
body:
## Description
Whenever an error occurred during editing a product a network error message is always displayed in the dialog box. I changed this behaviour and check if the error was a network error or some other error (maybe server down etc.) and display a meaningful message to the user accordingly. After OFF was shown on TV few days back, our servers went down and during that time many users faced "Network Errors" in the android app however their connection was alright and it was an issue due to the server, therefore displaying appropriate error message to the user is important.

title: Closes #1954 Fix crash on navigating back from search by barcode
body:
## Description
- Used `OFFApplication.getInstance()` to get the string resource to prevent crash.
- Removed lint warnings from the `HomeFragment.java`.
- Changed the endpoint of getting the total products count from `/1.json` to `/1.json?fields=null` and thus reducing the size of the json from **354.5 kB (3,54,485 bytes)** to **124 bytes**.
- Also cache the total products count and use it in the absence of internet connection.

## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #1954 
Probably Fixes #1943

The dynamic product count slows down the app

The dynamic product count slows down the app. It would probably make sense to cache the number, and adding pull to refresh.

Adding pull to refresh would also open the way to a more dynamic home in the future.

title: Closes #1924 : NullPointerException at AddProductOverviewFragment.
body:
## Description
While making toast the activity context is used which was creating the NullPointerException. As the activity is pushed to the background, the system may have killed the activity to reclaim memory for other foreground or visible process. And when the user navigates back to the activity (making it visible on the screen again), its onCreate(Bundle) method will be called with the savedInstanceState it had previously supplied in onSaveInstanceState(Bundle) so that it can restart itself in the same state as the user last left it, which I think may result in activityContext to be null. And as the AppProductActivity is a long living process activityContext may result in memory leak. So I replaced the activityContext with the applicationContext(). 

## Related issues and discussion
#1924 NullPointerException at AddProductOverviewFragment.

title: Closes #1922 Use POST request for uploading/editing products
body:
## Description
Use POST instead of GET for uploading products to the server.

## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #1922 
 
 ## Checklist
 
Make sure you've done all the following (You can delete the checklist before submitting)
 
 - [x] Apply the `AndroidStyle.xml` style template to your code in Android Studio.
 - [x] Code is well documented
 - [x] Include unit tests for new functionality
 - [x] All user-visible strings are made translatable
 - [x] Code passes Travis builds in your branch
 - [x] If you have multiple commits please combine them into one commit by squashing them.
 - [x] Read and understood the contribution guidelines.

title: Use POST request for uploading and editing products
label: [Label(name="editing"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="product addition")]

title: Add a user agent for Scan and requests made by the app
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="very high impact")]
body:
Add a user agent for Scan and requests made by the app
Something that tells it's the official client, and the version of the client. That enables us to differentiate actual scans from automated API calls, and is thus essential to rank products by scan.

title: Clarifying text for creating existing product in new language in app
body:
**Summary:** 

When scanning an English product and finding it already exists in French, it was unclear how to add an English version.




**Steps to reproduce:** 

Scan a product that already exists only in French and imagine you wish to add the product in English. While I could see that it was in French and French was listed as the language in the drop down, my assumption was that changing French to English in the drop down would overwrite the entry as being English and not French, i.e. French is deleted, English is added. 

This is the case with calories, for example, if edit the calories in a product this replaces the entry for calories completely, I assumed the same is the case for languages.

**Add system logs:**

Add log files here (if you are able to add).

**Expected behavior:** 

What did you expect the app to do?

Suggest clarifying text is added, probably on the dropdown list dialogue box for language, saying for example

"To add this product in a new language, select from the list below"

**Observed behavior:** 

What did you see instead?  Describe your issue in detail here.

**Device and Android version:** 

What make and model device (e.g., Samsung J7) did you encounter this on?  What Android version (e.g., Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich or Android 6.0 Marshmallow) are you running?  Is it the stock version from the manufacturer or a custom ROM?

**Screenshots:** 

https://greencloud.gn.apc.org/index.php/s/SgTBiFaX5wz6nB3

Can be created by pressing the Volume Down and Power Button at the same time on Android 4.0 and higher.

title: Closes #1907 Fix network error on clicking an empty category
body:
## Description
- Checked the count of the obtained results. If it is zero then display "no products found" layout instead of "no network layout".
- Also fixed a NPE which occurred when the category name was not found in the db, it resulted in NPE when trying to search for the tag belonging to that null category.

## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #1907 
 
 ## Screen-shots, if any
<kbd>![screenshot_20180921-004420](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10832531/45842108-5ca67b00-bd39-11e8-876a-3c0bc39ab1c0.png)</kbd>

 
 ## Checklist
 
Make sure you've done all the following (You can delete the checklist before submitting)
 
 - [x] Apply the `AndroidStyle.xml` style template to your code in Android Studio.
 - [x] Code is well documented
 - [x] Include unit tests for new functionality
 - [x] All user-visible strings are made translatable
 - [x] Code passes Travis builds in your branch
 - [x] If you have multiple commits please combine them into one commit by squashing them.
 - [x] Read and understood the contribution guidelines.

title: Selecting an empty category from the categories list displays network error
body:
**Checklist**
- [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search on the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting an issue.
- [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.
- [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover.

**Summary:** 
Clicking a category from the categories list displays network error when the category you clicked is empty (no products in OFF falls under that category).
Example of an [empty category](https://ssl-api.openfoodfacts.org/category/en:acesulfame-potassium/1.json?fields=product_name,brands,quantity,image_small_url,nutrition_grade_fr,code).

**Steps to reproduce:** 
1) Change the app's language to French.
2) Try clicking **Acsulfame potassium** in the categories list.

**Expected behavior:** 
I would expect something like: Oh no, we dont have any product in this category, can you add one ?

**Observed behavior:** 
No internet connection error is shown.

**Reported By:** 
@teolemon

title: Design: "Sign Up" button is misleading
body:
**Summary:** 
The Sign Up button doesn't create an account for you, instead it redirects you, which is unintuitive behavior for a button

**Steps to reproduce:** 
tapping on "Sign in" in the sidebar menu when logged out to get to the menu, entering account data and pressing "Sign Up" to create an account

**Expected behavior:** 
The app creates an account with the given data

**Observed behavior:** 
The app redirects to a page where one can create their account, so you'd need to re-enter the date

**Device and Android version:** 
Samsung Galaxy S7, Andorid 8.0 Oreo, v2.8.9

**Screenshots:** 
![screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13350549/45602290-aa855100-b9d0-11e8-94ad-5b1ab12db762.jpg)

**Solution:** 
better design / styling the button as a link

title: Closes #1853: StringIndexOutOfBoundsException in FindProductfragment.
body:
## Description
The number 93 was causing this Exception, so I added a check.

## Related issues and discussion
#1853 StringIndexOutOfBoundsException.

title: Possible Fix for #1722: MaterialDialog$DialogException: at openfoodfacts.github.scrachx.openfood.network.OpenFoodAPIClient$1.a (OpenFoodAPIClient.java:59)
body:
## Description
DialogException is caused by using MaterialDialog with an "invalid activity" (i.e. null, destroyed, finishing). Added some checks to hopefully prevent this. 

Also, there are some errors with the callback ` .onNegative((dialog, which) -> activity.onBackPressed())`, which occurs when there are many subsequent calls to `OpenFoodApiClient.getProduct()` that show a MaterialDialog. 

## Related issues and discussion
#1722

title: Closes #1870 : java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException in IngredientsProductFragment.
body:
## Description
Rectify the for loop condition. As the previous condition fail to put the last allergen on the list(line: 293), so when accessed the last allergen(line: 299) it was causing the java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException.

## Related issues and discussion
#1870 : java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException in IngredientsProductFragment.

title: Fixes #1874: Additives don't display in certain conditions
body:
## Description
Caused by trying to modify the view in a background thread. Moved RxJava call to .doOnSubscribe(...) to be called on the main thread. For some reason, the exception only sometimes propagated to RxJava callbacks (maybe depends on device, version, dev mode?).

## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #1874
 
 ## Screen-shots

title: Fixes #1846 The allergen field behaves weirdly
label: [Label(name="allergens")]
body:
## Description

The weird behaviour of allergen field was caused by improper regex matching of allergen names, which caused issues with allergens with multi-part names and improper spacing. For example the matching result for "lcithine de soja, bl" was ["lcithine ", "de ", "soja", "bl" ].

I've modified the regex to take this into consideration and to use commas a delimiters.

## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #1846
 
 ## Screen-shots, if any
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2354602/45276412-fa1ac880-b476-11e8-828c-6e8b63ff06ad.png)

title: Changing languages changes connexion status in side menu
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="login")]
body:
Changing languages changes connexion status in side menu
Switching from English to French will show different connexion status.

title: Check if any change is made in editing
label: [Label(name="editing")]
body:
**Steps to reproduce**
- Open the editing feature
- Do not edit anything
- Save edits

**Issue/Problem**
Even though you did not edit anything, the app saves you as the last editor. 

**Solution**
Only regard someone as a editor if at least one change is made.

title: Fixes #1864 Encoding error on the Product URL field search function
body:
## Description

The problem was caused by calling getText().toString() on a NachoTextView with chipified text, which would result in special characters that messed up the query. The proper way to get the chipified text is to call NachoTextView.getChipValues().

## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #1864

title: Closes #1854 : Fix product name not displayed in the quick view
body:
## Description
- Earlier the product name was saved in the HashMap with key `product_name` but now the key is appended with the language code therefore the key is not fixed now and depends with the product's language. The key can be `product_name_fr` or `product_name_en` depending upon the product's language.
- Since there was no value corresponding to the key `product_name` therefore "Name Unknown" was displayed every time. I have changed the key accordingly by appending the product's language code after the key thus getting the correct value of the product name.

## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #1854 
 
 ## Screen-shots, if any
<kbd>![screenshot_20180824-155624](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10832531/44580876-46001900-a7b9-11e8-9b81-81dc74b66999.png)</kbd> <kbd>![screenshot_20180824-155640](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10832531/44580899-64661480-a7b9-11e8-9d2d-0f4ad5fbbeda.png) </kbd>

The product name is now displayed in the quick view.
 
 ## Checklist
 
Make sure you've done all the following (You can delete the checklist before submitting)
 
 - [x] Apply the `AndroidStyle.xml` style template to your code in Android Studio.
 - [x] Code is well documented
 - [x] Include unit tests for new functionality
 - [x] All user-visible strings are made translatable
 - [x] Code passes Travis builds in your branch
 - [x] If you have multiple commits please combine them into one commit by squashing them.
 - [x] Read and understood the contribution guidelines.

title: "Name Unknown" is always displayed in quickView when adding a product offline
label: [Label(name="product addition"), Label(name="scanning")]
body:
**Checklist**
- [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search on the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting an issue.
- [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.
- [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover.

**Summary:** 
When adding a product through the scanner in the absence of network connection, the product gets saved locally and the information is displayed in the quick view at the bottom. The name field in in the quick view is always "Name Unknown" even when the name of the product was entered. 

**Steps to reproduce:** 
Turn off the Wi-Fi and mobile data. Open the app's scanner and scan a barocode to add it. Enter the product name, brand and quantity and the picture. Add the product. The product is saved offline and the scanner window is shown again with the entered product details appearing in the quick view. Instead of the product name which was entered, "Name Unknown" is displayed.

**Expected behavior:** 
The actual product name which was entered should have been displayed.

**Observed behavior:** 
"Name Unknown" is displayed.

**Screenshots:** 
<kbd>![screenshot_20180824-155624](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10832531/44580433-89f21e80-a7b7-11e8-9964-b099a1165802.png)</kbd> <kbd>![screenshot_20180824-155839](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10832531/44580383-60d18e00-a7b7-11e8-89eb-21b1c0234fb7.png)</kbd>

The name of the product (_Test Product_) is entered while saving the product however it is not displayed in the quick view.

title: Update version to match Tag
body: ...you'll need to reTag after merge

title: linting
body: Some refactoring after using the Linting feature of Android Studio

title: Turn the summary tab into an actual summary
label: [Label(name="feature"), Label(name="product browsing"), Label(name="very high impact")]
body: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1689815/44311279-b63b2300-a3e4-11e8-9d33-f2cb11898368.png)

title: Display a dismissable little message on the home screen if the translation is not complete
label: [Label(name="home"), Label(name="translations")]
body:
Display a dismissable little message on the home screen if the translation is not complete

"Help make Open Food Facts better in your language by translating it"
"Help make Open Food Facts better in Hindi by translating it"

There would be a link to https://translate.openfoodfacts.org or better yet to https://crowdin.com/project/openfoodfacts/hi#

title: New Crowdin translations
body: Enjoy!

The allergen field behaves weirdly

body:
We are also not displaying the nutrient modifiers in the product view (< > ~). 
Add the modifiers the same way they are added in the edit.

reported by @huzaifaiftikhar

title: Closes #1826: java.lang.IllegalStateException android.widget.TextView.onKeyUp
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
## Description
The issue #1826 was caused because the Edittext input method option(ime) was not set, so it by default seek for next focusable object, since it was not created, maybe in Blackberry Priv due to hardware keyboard it might have crashed the app, so I've set the ime option done in the last Edittext i.e (Alcohol Field) and same in the Java file (AddProductNutritionFactsFragment).

## Related issues and discussion
#1826 : java.lang.IllegalStateException android.widget.TextView.onKeyUp
 
 ## Screen-shots, if any
 
![44158851-6ce09000-a0d3-11e8-8471-309ffdd634ae](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32436867/44161286-7de0cf80-a0da-11e8-86ea-ca4059309875.png)

title: Closes #1826: java.lang.IllegalStateException android.widget.TextView.onKeyUp
body:
## Description
The issue #1826  was caused because the Edittext input method option(ime) was not set, so it by default seek for next focusable object, since it was not created, maybe in Blackberry Priv due to hardware keyboard it might have crashed the app, so I've set the **ime option done** in the last Edittext i.e (Alcohol Field) and same in the Java file (AddProductNutritionFactsFragment).

## Related issues and discussion
#1826 : java.lang.IllegalStateException android.widget.TextView.onKeyUp
 
 ## Screen-shots
 
![screenshot_1534349242](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32436867/44158851-6ce09000-a0d3-11e8-8471-309ffdd634ae.png)

title: RTL Direction for all products
label: [Label(name="RTL")]
body:
**Summary:** 

Hebrew, Farsi and Arabic are written in the opposite direction, we need to adjust the entire UI experience (Not only the mobile app but also the website) to support RTL directionality.

**Steps to reproduce:** 

Switch to Hebrew, Farsi or Arabic.

**Expected behavior:** 

When Hebrew, Farsi or Arabic is selected the app should flip horizontally.
As an example (Firefox 13 for iOS):
Hebrew - https://wopr.norad.org/~fxios/screenshots/fxios/v13/he/he/
English - https://wopr.norad.org/~fxios/screenshots/fxios/v13/en-US/en-US/
Hebrew:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/406826/44152404-2330a5d2-a0ae-11e8-97ed-8c67e71878b0.png)

English:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/406826/44152437-3735c67a-a0ae-11e8-9342-f5f242dfe33e.png)

**Observed behavior:** 

The text was changed to Hebrew but the direction remained the same making the sentences seem incomprehensible or misleading.

**Device and Android version:** 

Irrelevant.

**Screenshots:** 

(Added example screenshot of desired solution above).

title: Update README.md for GSoC 2018
Make the quickview displayed in the scanner slide up to display the complete product details
label: [Label(name="feature"), Label(name="priority"), Label(name="scanning"), Label(name="very high impact")]
body:
**Summary:** 
When scanning a product the key information is displayed on the bottom sheet (quick view). Clicking this opens the complete details about that product. Instead of this behaviour make the bottom sheet swipe up (similar to Google Maps and Play Music) to display the complete details about the instead of clicking it.

title: Closes #1808 : Fix android.view.InflateException on pre lollipop devices
body:
## Description
- The crash occurred on pre lollipop devices since vector drawable was used in in the XML file (`            android:drawableRight="@drawable/ic_arrow_drop_down"`)
- Removed this line from the XML and added the drawable right in the activity, which fixes this crash.

## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #1808 
 
 ## Checklist
 
Make sure you've done all the following (You can delete the checklist before submitting)
 
 - [x] Apply the `AndroidStyle.xml` style template to your code in Android Studio.
 - [x] Code is well documented
 - [x] Include unit tests for new functionality
 - [x] All user-visible strings are made translatable
 - [x] Code passes Travis builds in your branch
 - [x] If you have multiple commits please combine them into one commit by squashing them.
 - [x] Read and understood the contribution guidelines.

title: Product name appears for English although German selected
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="editing")]
body:
**Checklist**
- [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search on the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting an issue.
- [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.
- [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover.
**Summary:** 
In the new Android app version 2.8.7 (and sometimes also on older versions) the product name appears only in the English tab, although German was selected in the app. The German product name field is empty.

**Steps to reproduce:** 
Scan product, Add new product, German is preselected, enter product name (and other information), submit. Log in to the website for pre-procesing, open and edit that product: the German product name is empty, the entered string is in the English tab. No information was entered for English, so it should not even appear.

**Expected behavior:** 
Product name available in the selected language.

**Observed behavior:** 
Product name is in the English tab.

**Device and Android version:** 
Samsung Galaxy S6, LineageOS 14.1 (Android 7.1.2)

title: Update STATUS.md
Short term memory and comparison of products
body:
Feature idea for Android app : a way for the app to remember what I scanned earlier and compare it with what I scan now.
For example, if I scan a bottle of Pepsi, then  a bottle of Lemonade 10 minutes after, it would be nice if the app tells me "It's 10% less sweet than the bottle of Pepsi"
Particularly useful at the supermarket when I can't choose between two products

title: Suggestion: Implement Google smart lock for login
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="login")]
body:
> If you've never installed an app that supports Smart Lock, you may not realize how seamless it is, even moreso than relying on Autofill. You open the app the first time and if you've ever logged into that service from Chrome or another Android phone with Smart Lock enabled, you get a little pop-up asking you if you'd like to login using those saved credentials. No tapping on the user/email field to fill them up, no waiting and unlocking whichever Autofill app you use. It's a simple tap and you're logged in.

As suggested [here](https://www.androidpolice.com/2018/03/05/google-smart-lock-passwords-underused-underrated-wish-android-developers-implemented/)

title: Fixes #1761 Unexpected login of user
Unexpected Login of user
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="login")]
body:
User enters wrong credentials then also when again entering the app it shows "Logout.." instead of "Sign in" in side menu. 

How can we reproduce the issue?

First enter wrong credentials for eg: username = "abcdefgh" password = "abcdefgh".

![screenshot_2018-07-02-15-15-47-490_openfoodfacts github scrachx openbeauty](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34269503/42157742-35abc7c4-7e0c-11e8-8ada-ebf65a242f47.png)


Now press the sign in button and as expected it shows error of "username or password is incorrect".


![screenshot_2018-07-02-15-13-08-680_openfoodfacts github scrachx openbeauty](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34269503/42158002-d8641958-7e0c-11e8-9ba5-44b86aaa7886.png)

Now close the app and again open it and press the navigation button from the homepage and it can be noticed that there is "Logout" written instead of "Sign in".There should be sign in as the credentials were wrong.

![screenshot_2018-07-02-15-14-21-397_org openfoodfacts scanner](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34269503/42158161-528a8190-7e0d-11e8-8222-e80a550593cd.png)



Now press that "Logout" choice and it can be noticed that dialog box appears "Are you sure you want to logout ?"



![screenshot_2018-07-02-15-14-28-595_org openfoodfacts scanner](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34269503/42158255-927ee17e-7e0d-11e8-83fc-168773d50c97.png)






What did you expect the app to do?

According to me this there should not be "Logout" as user have not registered yet. 

Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 , Android version 7.0 , API 24

body:
App shows logged in even if user enters wrong credentials.

Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 , Android 7.0 , API 24.

title: Improve allergens and traces detection from ingredients lists
body:
We have 2 fields for allergens: allergens and traces. The value of the allergens field is created from the ingredients list of the main language of the product, and the values of the traces field are coming from users in the traces field of the product edit form.

Bug #1238 is going to change how the fields are populated: both allergens and traces will be extracted from the ingredients list, and users will have the opportunity to add (and only add) allergens with fields in the product edit form.

This new bug is to track changes and improvements to the allergens and traces detection.

In particular:
1. Detect if an allergen in the ingredient is an actual ingredient ("contains") or a trace, and put it in the correct field.
2. Add detection for allergens in parenthesis (e.g. farine de bl (gluten))
3. Detect allergens that are not in bold, underscores, parenthesis or all caps, but that are listed as as separate ingredient (e.g. "lait" and "crme", but not "crme de cassis").

title: Implement MainActivity.changeFragment()
label: [Label(name="refactoring"), Label(name="ux")]
body:
## Description

I have created a new method in MainActivity called changeFragment().

This is designed to allow fragment transitions where the parent activity is MainActivity, and therefore should eliminate the need of having one method each for fragment transitions (eg. moveToBarcodeEntry(), moveToPreferences()).

Note that a Fragment object is required as an argument, so this object will need to be created before using this method.

## Related issues and discussion
N/A - minor refactor, so did not create
  
 ## Checklist
 
Make sure you've done all the following (You can delete the checklist before submitting)
 
 - [x] Apply the `AndroidStyle.xml` style template to your code in Android Studio.
 - [x] Code is **_well_** documented
 - [ ] Include unit tests for new functionality [N/A - refactor]
 - [x] All user-visible strings are made translatable
 - [x] Code passes Travis builds in your branch
 - [x] If you have multiple commits please combine them into one commit by squashing them.
 - [x] Read and understood the contribution guidelines .

title: Allow searching for uncategorized product if the category is empty
label: [Label(name="categories explorer")]
body:
Allow searching for uncategorized products with the name of the category if the category is empty. 
A nice plus would be to allow the logged-in user to add some of the results of that search to the category

title: Add thorough product addition and integrate OCR for ingredients
label: [Label(name="GSoC 2018"), Label(name="product addition")]
body:
## Description
* Implemented the UI of the product addition activity
* Added auto-complete for countries, categories, labels and traces (allergens).
* Added auto-complete for EMB code dynamically from server.
* Added basic checks for nutrition values.
  * pH shouldn't exceed 14.
  * Alcohol % shouldn't exceed 100%.
  * Sum of sugar and starch should be less than carbohydrate.
* Added OCR for ingredients.
* Modify product addition to work for all the app flavors.
* Added option to scan QR code of product website or even search for product website.
* Added offline mode for product addition.
* Complete product addition possible for OFF, OBF, OPF and OPFF.
* Updated UI of Offline edit list.
* Added checks when uploading a product saved offline. If the product being uploaded is already present on the server it is checked that if it has an existing value of product name or ingredients or quantity or link. If any of these value already exist, the user is shown a dialog to choose between his version or the version present on the server. The product is uploaded only after all the conflicting values are resolved by the user.

## Files Deleted
* `IngredientsProductFragment.java.orig`
* `SaveOfflineSummaryFragment.java`
* `SaveProductOfflineActivity.java`
* `activity_save_product_offline.xml`
* `fragment_offline_summary_product.xml`

## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #1553 
Fixes #1554 
Fixes #126
Fixes #455 
Fixes #1724 
Closes #1652 
Closes #1637  
Closes #1623 
Closes #987
Closes #1721 
Closes #1708 

 ## Screen-shots, if any

title: fix: issue #1701 Null pointer Exception in models/Nutriments.java
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="nutrition facts")]
body:
## Description

Added checks for Null pointers in-case a particular data point was absent or present as null. It was trying to Convert a null to a string which was causing this issue. I believe there is a bigger root issue possibly here. Maybe the data should never be null however I think this check does not harm in either case.

title: Dirty Oreo service fix
label: [Label(name="Oreo"), Label(name="hack"), Label(name="service")]

title: Closes Issue#1689: Added Swipe Down feature to go back to Main Activity
label: [Label(name="scanning")]
body:
## Description

Describe the changes made and why they were made instead of how they were made.

- Created a separate SwipeDetector class to detect the type of Swipe Touch Event on screen.
- Created a function to detect swipe down event on continous scan activity and navigate back to main screen.
- Created animations resource file for swipe up and swipe down in res/anim folder.

title: Error when uploading additional photos with mobile Firefox on Android/LineageOS
label: [Label(name="editing")]
body:
**Checklist**
- [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search on the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting an issue.
- [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.
- [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover.

**Summary:** 
Error when uploading additional photos with mobile Firefox on Android/LineageOS

**Steps to reproduce:** 
In the Andriod app scan existing product's barcode. Tap edit. Tap Add image. Take a picture and confirm it.

**Expected behavior:** 
The taken picture should appear in the pictures list. 

**Observed behavior:** 
The message appears: "error - missing product code"

**Device and Android version:** 
2 x Galaxy S6: stock Android 7.0 and LineageOS 14.1 (= Android 7.1.2), Firefox 60.0.1 and 60.0.2

title: On a LineageOS 14.1 scanning a barcode shows no camera image.
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="scanning")]
body:
**Checklist**
- [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search on the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting an issue.
- [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.
- [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover.
**Summary:** 
On a LineageOS 14.1 (= Android 7.1.2) scanning a barcode shows no camera image.

**Steps to reproduce:** 
Open the app and tap the red barcode scanner icon in lower right corner.

**Expected behavior:** 
A camera image is displayed and the barcode is then recognized.

**Observed behavior:** 
No image with the red barscanner line in the middle.

**Device and Android version:** 
This works fine on the same model (Samsung Galaxy S6) with stock Android 7.0, both run the app in version 0.9.0.2 from the F-Droid store.
On the LineageOS smartphone the app does not crash, it simply does not show both the front and rear camera's image. The difference might be the camera app that is org.cyanogenmod.snap (2.0.002)

title: The category call is wrong when the app is not in English
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="categories explorer"), Label(name="i18n")]
body:
The category call is wrong when the app is not in English
As a result, the category browser doesn't show the product we have in many/most cases.
```https://ssl-api.openfoodfacts.org/category/Maquereaux%20en%20conserve/1.json?fields=product_name,brands,quantity,image_small_url,nutrition_grade_fr,code```

This returns 0 results

The taxonomy stored is:
```"en:tinned-mackerels":{"parents":["en:canned-fishes","en:mackerels"],"name":{"en":"Tinned Mackerels","fr":"Maquereaux en conserve","nl":"Makreel in blik"}}```

As a result, the call should be ```https://ssl-api.openfoodfacts.org/category/en:tinned-mackerels/1.json?fields=product_name,brands,quantity,image_small_url,nutrition_grade_fr,code```

title: Closes #1551 : Add continuous scan and improve the UI of the scanner
label: [Label(name="GSoC 2018"), Label(name="scanning")]
body:
## Description
* Add continuous scan feature. 
* Changed the UI of the scan fragment.
* Removed Power Scan mode as it is not needed anymore.
* Removed method `getShortProduct` from `OpenFoodAPIClient.java` as it was used only in Power Scan mode.
* Deleted `BarCodeScannerFragment.java`, `ScannerFragmentActivity.java`, `alert_powermode_image.xml` and `fragment_scanner.xml` as they are not used anymore.
* Removed dependency `me.dm7.barcodescanner:zxing` and replaced it with `com.journeyapps:zxing-android-embedded` for smooth scanning.

## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #1551 
 
 ## Screen-shots, if any
Added curved edges
<kbd>![videotogif_2018 05 29_17 19 16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10832531/40657289-f39930cc-6364-11e8-878a-b9a51ca31e11.gif)</kbd>

When offline
<kbd>![videotogif_2018 05 29_17 22 15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10832531/40657369-3c0086ee-6365-11e8-9e87-fcce9c67e5de.gif)</kbd>

 
 ## Checklist
 
Make sure you've done all the following (You can delete the checklist before submitting)

title: Refresh taxonomies only is the only file has changed
label: [Label(name="taxonomies"), Label(name="very high impact")]
body:
- We currently refresh every 24 hours:
https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/blob/585b4561869360c73b22cc4b95edcb1e69628284/app/src/main/java/openfoodfacts/github/scrachx/openfood/views/splash/SplashPresenter.java#L22
- We should only refresh if 'If-Modified-Since" is sent back
https://android.jlelse.eu/reducing-your-networking-footprint-with-okhttp-etags-and-if-modified-since-b598b8dd81a1
- Clarify the loading screen. During taxonomy loading, display "Initialisation" instead of "Loading"

title: Sign up button not working
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="login")]
body:
#### Expected behavior      Users should be able to sign up   when they click on the sign up button.


#### Actual behavior      The app refuse to respond to the   sign up button when it is clicked on, which means its not working.


#### How to reproduce
1. Install, Launch and grant all necessary permissions   2. Click on the menu slider icon (located in the top   left corner of the app)   3. Click on sign in option   4. Click on the sign up      It will be observed   that there is no response from the app, while the other buttons such as sign   in and forgot password worked perfectly.

* Browser/App version: app   version 0.9.0.1
*Operating system: Android 6.0
* Device: Infinix Note 3
#### Recording Of The Bug      https://youtu.be/HoNSn6JWrL8


#### GitHub Account
https://github.com/jubreal

title: Closes #1602 : Categories are hard to click on in the Categories Explorer.
body:
## Description

As for the changes I've reduced the size of fast scroller bar from wrap_content to 24dp in fragment_category_list.xml and the code that was causing the problem was in the textView of category_recycler_item.xml. As the textView was selectable it doesn't allow proper clicking in the recyclerView so I removed (android:textIsSelectable="true") it in the XML. 

## Related issues and discussion
Categories are hard to click on in the Categories Explorer.
Issue Number: #1602

title: Closes #287 : Change wording of offline mode warning popup for Open Beauty Facts.
body:
## Description
Changed wording of offline mode warning popup for Open Beauty Facts and other 4 versions from "You can scan products when you're offline to add them to Open Food Facts later. All the products you scan will appear here, and you'll be able to send them using the button below." to "Scan the products even when you are offline so as to add them to Open Beauty Facts later. The scanned products will appear here and you will be able to send them using the button below. " and other changes according to respective versions.

## Related issues and discussion
Change wording of offline mode warning popup for Open Beauty Facts
Issue Number: #287

Converted the offline notification string into a singular/plural variant.

**Previous string version**: You have %1$d offline products waiting to be contributed to Open Food Facts
**Singular**: You have 1 offline product waiting to be contributed to Open Food Facts.
**Plural**: You have %d offline products waiting to be contributed to Open Food Facts 

## Related issues and discussion
 Offline notification needs to have a singular/plural variant.

Issue Number: #1494

title: An "About" screen to make reporting bugs easier
label: [Label(name="settings")]
body:
Most apps have an "About" screen that shows information about the app. This app does not. It'd be nice if had one that included at least the following information: name, version, description, copyright, link to homepage, link to report a bug. For example,

> OpenFoodFacts Android App,  version 0.999,  December 2018
> Scan, search and contribute to the [OpenFoodFacts](http://openfoodfacts.org) collaborative database of food facts.
> Copyright 2018, for your rights, please read the [Apache License 2.0](https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.html)
> [Read more at OpenFoodFacts.org](http://openfoodfacts.org)
> [Report a bug in this app](http//github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues)

This will take the guesswork out of what version is being run and will make it easier to report bugs.

title: Amazon Fire Phone (reversed AF)
label: [Label(name="Amazon devices"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="scanning")]
body:
### Summary

When I use the app to scan, I expect it to autofocus. It does not. In the three-dots menu, I can see that it says, **Auto Focus [ON]**.  If I click on it so it switches to **Auto Focus [OFF]**, then my camera does autofocus correctly.

### Device and Android version:

Amazon Fire Phone (model number SD4930UR)
Fire OS 4.6.6.1 (Amazon's fork of Android 4.4, KitKat)

The version of OpenFood I'm running is 0.8.9 (installed using [F-droid](https://f-droid.org)).

By the way, I do not think Issue #534 is related as that only changed the APK manifest, if I'm reading it right.

title: Fixes #1500; better handling of scan on shake settings changes
label: [Label(name="ux")]
body:
## Description

Previously, selecting "Scan on Shake" in the preferences fragment restarted the main activity. Relevant SharedPreferences calls have been refactored into a new method (```setShakePreferences()```), and new method is now called from ```onCreate``` and ```onSharedPreferenceChanged```. The method avoids duplicating the lines which: A) assign the ```shakePreference.getBoolean``` value to the ```scanOnShake``` variable, and B) create the ```ShakeListener``` object. 

## Related issues and discussion
#1500

title: Closes #1544 : Extra space displayed before values
body:
## Description

When product.getPackaging() is split and set into packagings array, all the words after index 0 have whitespace by default in the beginning. So to resolve this problem I've trimmed the word at "i" position every time when for loop is executed.

title: Xml recyclerView improves
label: [Label(name="refactoring")]
body:
## Description

tools:listitem / tools:listheader / tools:listfooter
Intended for: <AdapterView> (and subclasses like <ListView>)

Used by: Android Studio layout editor

These attributes specify which layout to show in the layout preview for a list's items, header, and footer. Any data fields in the layout are filled with numeric contents such as "Item 1" so that the list items are not repetitive.

For example:

<ListView xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
    android:id="@android:id/list"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    **tools:listitem="@layout/sample_list_item"
    tools:listheader="@layout/sample_list_header"
    tools:listfooter="@layout/sample_list_footer"** />


 ## Screen-shots, if any

Editor without ListItem attribute 

![screenw whitout listitem](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4539769/39656072-287754e4-5006-11e8-86e1-2aace51d98b5.png)

Editor with  ListItem attribute 

![screen with listitem](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4539769/39656102-4a0dc692-5006-11e8-83dc-fb0935fa6511.png)

title: Edit products within the app
label: [Label(name="GSoC 2018"), Label(name="editing")]
body:
**Summary:** 

Editing or adding information about the already added products using the android application. It is more convenient and easy to use mobile and hence this would help us in getting more products completed. The UI for editing a product would be similar to theone as described in #1553 only with the difference that the already known details about that product will be displayed but made editable.

title: Integrate OCR for ingredients
label: [Label(name="GSoC 2018"), Label(name="editing"), Label(name="product addition")]
body:
**Summary:** 

Presently we do not have an option to add ingredients during the addition of a new product. However, after implementing #1553 , users will get an option to add all the details about the product during its addition including ingredients. Rather than having the user type all the ingredients of the product which is a tedious task we can use the ingredients image uploaded by the user and extract ingredients from it using OCR.

Here is the [link](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1bHmLgUyGX_JAKZhgeNACfb-_xJrunm6p/view?usp=sharing) of the video which demonstrates this feature.
I plan to use this [library](https://github.com/rmtheis/tess-two).

label: [Label(name="GSoC 2018"), Label(name="scanning")]
body:
**Summary:**

This will enable users to scan barcodes at an unmatched speed. Scanning different barcodes one after the other without any interaction with the user.

Here is the [link](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_4VnCqgn3VbM9AZ7L7G8WY_jNRyucbhl/view?usp=sharing) to the demo of this feature that I plan to integrate into the app during GSoC 2018.

title: Fixed #1433: android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: duplicate column name wiki_data_id
body:
Unfortunately I couldn't repeat this bug, but I added column check, so it probably should help.
Most likely that earlier database was modified, but the version of db wasn't increased, so there are some users, who installed new version of app without updated db version.
After that we finally wrote migration and increased db version, but there were some users, who already had application with updated db, so when they install new version of app (with migration) they are getting error.
#1433

title: Fixed #1433: android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: duplicate column name wiki_data_id
body:
Unfortunately I couldn't repeat this bug, but I added column check, so it probably should help.
Most likely that earlier database was modified, but the version of db wasn't increased, so there are some users, who installed new version of app without updated db version. 
After that we finally wrote migration and increased db version, but there were some users, who already had application with updated db, so when they install new version of app (with migration) they are getting error.

title: Scan on Shake in preferences makes the app go back to homescreen
label: [Label(name="easy fix"), Label(name="ux")]
body:
**Checklist**
- [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search on the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting an issue.
- [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.
- [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover.

**Summary:** 
Clicking the checkbox of _Scan on Shake_ in _Preferences_ navigates the user back to the home screen. The checkbox should function like other checkboxes (_Scan on startup_ and _Power mode scan_).

**Steps to reproduce:** 
Open Preferences from the Navigation Drawer. Click on _Scan on Shake_.

**Expected behavior:** 
The Scan on Shake checkbox should get checked/unchecked depending upon its previous value.

**Observed behavior:** 
Navigated back to Home Screen.

title: Onboarding slides are shown everytime the app is launched
label: [Label(name="easy fix"), Label(name="onboarding")]
body:
**Checklist**
- [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search on the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting an issue.
- [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.
- [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover.

**Summary:** 
Onboarding slides are shown everytime the app is launched.

**Steps to reproduce:** 
After a fresh install (or clearing data) the onboarding slides are shown. Swipe these slides till the last slide. Swipe the last slide too. (Do not use the _SKIP_, _NEXT_ or _GOT IT_ buttons). Home screen is launched. Exit the app and then launch the app again. Onboarding slides are shown again. (Also if we press the back button from home the onboarding slides are shown again, this should not happen)

**Expected behavior:** 
Onboarding slides should be shown only once.

**Observed behavior:** 
Onboarding slides are shown everytime.

**Screenshots:** 
![videotogif_2018 04 19_08 17 24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10832531/38968746-6bd88c3e-43aa-11e8-8ef8-dc94d833d237.gif)

title: Closes #1256 : Many Travis build are failing, exceeding the time limit
body:
## Description
Tweak Travis script to fix Travis builds
- removed `- ./gradlew assembleDebug --stacktrace` from _install_
- speedup travis by caching maven
- removed `build` as it was redundant with `connectedCheck` 
- **reduced build time by 15-20 mins** by adding Build Stages and performing checks for all the flavors in parallel

#### **Time Analysis** 

- Approximately **4-5 mins** are spent in **installing Android dependencies** 
- **6-10 mins** are spent in **creating emulator**
- **10-12 mins** are spent in **downloading from maven**.
- The compiling, installing and running tests for each flavour takes approximately **6-7 mins**.

## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #1256 
 
 ## Checklist
 
Make sure you've done all the following (You can delete the checklist before submitting)
 
 - [x] Apply the `AndroidStyle.xml` style template to your code in Android Studio.
 - [x] Code is well documented
 - [x] Include unit tests for new functionality
 - [x] All user-visible strings are made translatable
 - [x] Code passes Travis builds in your branch
 - [x] If you have multiple commits please combine them into one commit by squashing them.
 - [x] Read and understood the contribution guidelines .

title: Cannot upload in airplane mode, even with wifi on
label: [Label(name="contribution"), Label(name="offline")]
body:
#**Checklist**
- [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search on the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting an issue.
- [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.
- [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover.

**Summary:** 

Following #923, it is not possible to click on the "Upload all" button when in airplane mode, even when Wireless is enabled (Wifi is automatically disabled when Airplane mode is activated, but it can be manually re-enabled afterwards - Airplane mode is mainly concerned with disabling the cellular antenna).

I believe the condition implemented in https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/pull/926 is too strict, since I can and frequently scan products while on Airplane mode. Maybe I don't see the exact usage scenario, but it seems that testing "Network connectivity" might be sufficient.

Overall, this is a minor issue since airplane mode can often be disabled without much issue, it's just a bit unexpected. Feel free to close this if not deemed worth of the effort.

**Steps to reproduce:** 

1. Scan products without connectivity (to add them to the Offline edit list)
2. Activate airplane mode
3. Enable wireless
4. Go to offline edit and click Upload All

**Add system logs:**

**Expected behavior:** 

I should be able to click Upload All, since there is network connectivity via wireless.

**Observed behavior:** 

I got the message about "Airplane mode enabled" described in https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/pull/926.

**Device and Android version:** 

Motorola Moto X Style, Stock Android 6.0 Marshmallow

**Screenshots:** 

(I uploaded the products after leaving airplane mode to test, so I don't have an Offline edit list anymore to easily reproduce it and capture a screenshot)

title: Onboarding slide is exited on swiping right from the last slide
label: [Label(name="onboarding"), Label(name="ux")]
body:
**Checklist**
- [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search on the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting an issue.
- [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.
- [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover.

**Summary:** 
Onboarding slide is exited and home screen is shown even if a user swipes right that means the user is trying to go back to the previous slide. The slides should exit only if a user swipes left on the last slide.

**Steps to reproduce:** 
After a fresh install, open the app. Onboarding slides will appear. Go to the last slide by swiping left 3 times. Now try to go back to the previous slide by swiping right once.

**Expected behavior:** 
The previous slide should have been displayed.

**Observed behavior:** 
The slides view is exited and Home screen is displayed.

**Screenshots:** 
![videotogif_2018 04 09_23 46 29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10832531/38515008-723d3298-3c50-11e8-8fc0-6a69e7f69e3c.gif)

title: Closes #1413 : Add padding to "Get the facts" onboarding slide
label: [Label(name="onboarding")]
body:
## Description
- Reformat onboarding slides layout.
- Removed redundant _LinearLayout_ from all the four onboarding layouts.
- Added padding to the text in all the four onboarding slides as padding was missing in all the four layouts.
- Converted _history.png_ to vector drawable as it got pixelated earlier. 

## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #1413
 
 ## Screen-shots, if any

 - [x] Include unit tests for new functionality

- [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.

Launcher icon of OPF is not perfectly circular. It has an unwanted shape outside the circle. This will be visible only on dark wallpapers.

title: Closes #1288: added prepared info
label: [Label(name="product browsing")]
body:
## Description

Added prepared info in a expandable view, as most products don't have prepared values by this they will be hidden. I have used [Expandable Layout](https://github.com/cachapa/ExpandableLayout) library for implementing expandable view. I have made some changes in nutriments to access prepared values. I have used arrows to symbolise the expandability of rows.

## Related issues and discussion

label: [Label(name="account management"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="ux")]
body:
**Summary:** 

"Sign in" appears in the drawer when the user is already signed in after re-launching app.

**Steps to reproduce:** 

1. Sign in to Open Food Facts.
2. Close the app (and kill it).
3. Re-open and observe the drawer.

**Add system logs:**
NA


**Expected behaviour**

Button shows the "Logout" option with icon.

**Observed behavior:** 

Button shows "Sign In" still.

**Device and Android version:** 
NA

**Screenshots:** 

![screenshot_20180406-181725](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20950727/38434844-c37e1a7c-39c7-11e8-80e6-ded0af021679.jpg)

title: GreenDao upgrade
body:
Implemented faster way to save taxonomies translations.
Previously, to save each record, GreenDao used a new transaction, it had awful effect on performance.
At the moment, GreenDao saves records using only 1 transaction.
Look at "Performance" header: http://greenrobot.org/greendao/documentation/technical-faq/

title: Create a new flavor of the app
body:
(This bug needs to be solved before tomorrow)
Create a new flavor of the app called opf

It should introduce the following behaviours:
```
- support for weirder barcodes
- disable nutriscore
- add new intro slides (ask @teolemon in private)
- disable allergen detector
- specific branding (ask @teolemon in private)
- disable advanced search and charts
- replace Open Beauty Facts promo by Open Food Facts promo```

title: Closes #336 : Use WebP to reduce APK size
label: [Label(name="apk size")]
body:
## Description
- Converted large sized PNGs/JPGs to smaller webP images wherever possible. 
- Skipped conversion of images with transparency as it requires API>18 and our app has minimum API set to 16.
- **Changed files**
-- header.jpg (35KB) to header.webp (9KB)
-- image_home.png (47.8KB) to image_home.webp (14.4KB)
-- placeholder_thumb.gif (2.42KB) to placeholder_thumb.webp (1.04KB)

## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #336
 
 ## Checklist
 
Make sure you've done all the following (You can delete the checklist before submitting)
 
 - [x] Apply the `AndroidStyle.xml` style template to your code in Android Studio.
 - [x] Code is well documented
 - [x] Include unit tests for new functionality
 - [x] All user-visible strings are made translatable
 - [x] Code passes Travis builds in your branch
 - [x] If you have multiple commits please combine them into one commit by squashing them.
 - [x] Read and understood the contribution guidelines.

title: Closes #518: OFF and OBF logos are in the wrong languages
label: [Label(name="translations")]
body:
## Description
- I have used a logo without tagline and a TextView below it to show the slogan in the HomeScreen. The TextView is translatable and hence changes as the user switches the locale.
- In the splash activity, we used drawable as a background in styles which was static. Now I have created a new layout for splash activity. However, this is not as visible as it was earlier as this activity is switched with another activity instantly and the layout is not visible. It is only visible when we open the application for the first time (fresh install or after data clear, basically during taxonomies download) as data is being downloaded at that time.
## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #518
 
 ## Screen-shots, if any
**This is how the home screen logo will change depending upon the locale.** 
![videotogif_2018 04 07_15 48 28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10832531/38453943-9e60d266-3a7b-11e8-8acc-bf849a570dd4.gif)

**This is how the splash screen looks.**
![videotogif_2018 04 01_21 15 01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10832531/38175256-4ff6a6ce-35f7-11e8-94af-8101e308b591.gif)

 ## Checklist
 
Make sure you've done all the following (You can delete the checklist before submitting)
 
 - [x] Apply the `AndroidStyle.xml` style template to your code in Android Studio.
 - [x] Code is well documented
 - [x] Include unit tests for new functionality
 - [x] All user-visible strings are made translatable
 - [x] Code passes Travis builds in your branch
 - [x] If you have multiple commits please combine them into one commit by squashing them.
 - [x] Read and understood the contribution guidelines.

title: Number of products duplication [ProductBrowsingListActivity].
body:
**Summary:** 
When the user search about product the list of available products will show up with the number of products in the list, and when user try to search again about different product from ProductBrowsingListActivity the number of new products is append to the last number.

**Steps to reproduce:** 
Using setText method on text view instead of append.

**Expected behavior:** 
only number of current products will appear.

**Screenshots:** 
![textduplication](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16237969/37798664-159bc370-2e26-11e8-9de5-6081d6e2ba70.gif)

title: Fix #1285 App Crash in MainActivity.java
body:
## Description
I put a null checking condition when firing an Intent in MainActivity.class to open the OpenFoodFacts app via The OpenBeautyApp, updated string resource file for toast displayed and also made an intent to open up the app settings of the Disabled App.
Because If the OpenFoodFacts app is installed but disabled and the normal intent is fired, it crashes the app.

title: Adds tests for home fragment
label: [Label(name="home")]
body:
## Description

This is an attempt to begin the testing suite of the app. Currently, MainActivity cannot be tested due to a lot of interconnected Idling resources, therefore I am slightly modifying the main activity to make it fit for testing.
Besides this, I have added a FragmentTestActivity for the testing of a single fragment. I have added the test for the HomeFragment. I will be adding more espresso tests for the other fragments as well. 

* Modified MainActivity to make it fit for testing
* Added a FragmentTestActivity for testing individual fragments
* A small test for HomeFragment

I am also planning to open a discussion issue regarding MVVM and testing instructions for the app.

NA

title: Fixed #517: Splash screen fix for Open Food Facts
label: [Label(name="splash screen"), Label(name="ux")]
body:
## Description The splash screen logo was broken at some phones as already mentioned in the issue. So I spent some time searching and reading articles about making splash screen properly for android apps. Then I discovered about something called 9 Patch PNGs from here which stretch good for all resolutions:
https://medium.com/@101/splash-screen-in-android-769d3b0bafd0 I went for the tool provided by Google to produce 9 patch images of the logo instead the one we were previously using and included them. And used them accordingly. ## Related issues and discussion #517 ## Screen-shots, if any Outputs for 2 phones 1. MOTO E Android Version 5.1 This was before:
This was after: 2. XIOMI MI Redmi Note 2 Android 5.0.2 Before:
After:
I have tested this for all devices available at my home. Do tell me if any more optimization needs to be done. I have done this for Open Food Facts flavor till now. If it convinces all the mentors I will send quick PR for other flavors too Thanks.

title: Home screen lacks user-engagement content
label: [Label(name="home")]
body: On opening the app for the first time user is greeted with almost a blank screen with most of the features of the app hidden behind a navigation bar. This makes the experience dull. - Instead we can show some items when the user opens the app for the first time like (most viewed food products and their nutritional value, top food products in the location and recently added products) (Similar to RecipeBook App) - Show important features of the app in bottom bar. (because a user is more likely to click a bottombar than a navbar) I want to make the home screen more engaging but is there any existing end points which I can use to display contents like (most viewed food products, top food products in location ) ?

## Description

I put a null checking condition when firing an Intent in MainActivity.class to open the OpenFoodFacts app via The OpenBeautyApp, updated string resource file for toast displayed and also made an intent to open up the app settings of the Disabled App.

title: Fixed #1268: Resolved invaild item error and implemented swipe refresh properly
body:
## Description

When the list was refreshed the `list<products>` were cleared so when user swipes app tries to access the next element from an empty products list that's why the error, there was no need for the `products.clear()` statement as the products was assigned a empty product list ,so I removed it. The swipe refresh was not implemented properly I also corrected it by using  ` swipeRefreshLayout.setRefreshing(false);`  after data loads from API which is not done currently. 

## Related issues and discussion
closes #1268 
 
 ## Screen-shots

Initial
![swiperefresh-faulty](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22943390/37622498-ccced456-2be7-11e8-9ce7-23474a74ef30.gif)

After changes

![swiperefresh](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22943390/37622503-d4332e36-2be7-11e8-9895-13e928b0a86b.gif)

title: Fixed #1231, fixed #1261, fixed #1233: Gson + Performance issues.
label: [Label(name="refactoring")]
body:
#1279 
 - fixed duplicated additives
 - added "synchronized" modifier for methods which save data. It improved performance a little bit.

#1261
 - removed Gson from the whole project. In cases of use Gson I switched to Jackson.

#1233
 - moved loading from the database to background thread. It probably improved performance.

title: Fixed: #1231,#1261,#1233
body:
#1231 
 - fixed duplicated additives
 - added "synchronized" modifier for methods which save data. It improved performance a little bit.

#1261 
 - removed Gson from the whole project. In cases of use Gson I switched to Jackson.

#1233
 - moved loading from the database to background thread. It probably improved performance.

label: [Label(name="categories")]
body:

 - implemented loading of translated categories from the local database (or using new API taxonomies/categories.json) in the Category browser.
 - implemented opening of Categories list by click on category in the Category browser.
 
#903
- implemented new light API to load products by category.

Please search on the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting an issue. - [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software. - [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover. **Summary:** The Load Toast in LoginActivity keeps loading even after the incorrect password message has been shown. title: Closes #117 : Calculate calories for given weight
label: [Label(name="product browsing")]
body:
## Description

- Added option to calculate calories for given weight in the overflow menu. This option in the overflow menu will hide automatically for products that are incomplete and don't have the calories information.

- Moved `getEnergy` method from _NutritionInfoProductFragment.java_ to _Utils.java_ as this method is now used in two different classes.

- Added custom layout background for the spinner as the in the default spinner layout the drop-down arrow was far away from the text and didn't look good. Somewhat like [this](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/34322156/how-to-move-the-android-spinner-drop-down-arrow-closer-to-its-emitting-text/34322887).

title: It should be possible to slide out the intro slides
label: [Label(name="onboarding")]
body: It should be possible to slide out the intro slides, from the last slide. Currently you have to move your finger to Okay.

title: Fixing the multiple clicks on home button part of issue #1262
body:
## Description

Every time on back-button is pressed  control returns to home fragment.
## Related issues and discussion
#1262

title: Fragments keeps changing among them on back press
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Fragments keep changing between them in order they were called 

**Steps to reproduce:** 

1. Open the app
2. Click on Search by barcode
3. Click on Home
4. Click on Search by barcode
5. Click on Home again

repeat this and
 
Now press back button and `home `and `Search by barcode ` appears again and again.

**One problem is that when you press Home 5 time and now you want to exit the app you have to press the back button 5 times**


**Expected behavior:** 
From any fragment if back button is pressed it should return to home fragment.


**Screenshots:** 

![ezgif com-video-to-gif](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22103919/37552930-3f33979e-29e4-11e8-978f-bc41b3d41b3f.gif)

title: Both Jackson and Gson library is used in app. Should be one of them.
label: [Label(name="apk size")]
body: At present both Jackson and Gson Library is used to handle JSON results whereas we can work with any one of them and remove the other which would help in reducing the APK's size.

title: New Crowdin translations
body: Enjoy!

title: Scanning can be slow
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="scanning"), Label(name="speed")]
body: Scanning can be slow, the viewfinder freezes for several seconds, probably when it's loading the JSON. We should directly jump to the page, and display a placeholder until it's loaded.

title: Offline mode is slow
label: [Label(name="offline"), Label(name="speed")]
body: Saving a product in offline mode is slow. It should be instant, even if work is done on the background: People want to scan / save as many products as possible, very quickly.

title: Nutrition Facts layout not symmetrical and hides values
label: [Label(name="nutrition facts"), Label(name="product browsing"), Label(name="ux")]
body:
**Checklist**
- [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search on the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting an issue.
- [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.
- [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover.

**Summary:** 
In the nutrition facts, the layout of the table being created is not correct and the values go out the screen if the text is long.

**Expected behavior:** 
Symmetrical table which is readable should have been displayed and values shouldn't go out of the view.

**Observed behavior:** 
Table not properly generated.

title: Closes #506: Getting information from wikidata.
label: [Label(name="product browsing"), Label(name="wikidata")]
body:
## Description

- Categories, Labels and Additives are now linked with Wikidata.

- At present, not all categories, labels and additives have Wikidata id so to distinguish them I've used `name : Wiki link present` as the name on the product page it can be changed if a better option is suggested.

- If Wikidata id is present for any item a bottom sheet appears on click of that item and label, description and Wikipedia link for that item is shown on the sheet.

- On click of Wikipedia links opens Wikipedia page of that item.

- An option to browse product is also added which allows the user to search product by that category, label or additive which open list of product in productBrowsingActivity.

- The items which don't contain Wikidata ID would work as before i.e onClicking these items user would be taken to productBrowsingActivity to browse products.

## Related issues and discussion
#506 
 
 ## Screen-shots, if any

![wikilink](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25099208/37425818-c2140d2a-27ea-11e8-852d-a20789951be6.png)


![informationwikidata](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25099208/37425731-682a2df8-27ea-11e8-83c1-a22b1337ab54.png)


**Wikipedia page opened in CustomTab:**


![wikipedia](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25099208/37425719-5c68a9f4-27ea-11e8-8995-50df269a87cc.png)




@teolemon @Karljoones @policorn please review this PR :).

title: Bug in search.
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="search")]
body:
**Summary:** 

On refreshing the search list by swiping the layout, multiple recycler view gets Stacked, the number of stacked recyclerview would be equal to the number of times layout is swiped, and we need to press back multiple times to get back to search results.
Also `onLoad()` method appends countOfProducts every time when it gets the `true` response which is should not happen.

**Steps to reproduce:** 

Use search------>Swipe layout to refresh multiple times---->Click on any item.

Now to get back to search results multiple times back need to be pressed.

**Screenshots:** 

**Product count is appended multiple times: **

![screenshot_2018-03-13-06-18-37-438_openfoodfacts github scrachx openfood](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25099208/37317497-33c3964a-268b-11e8-81fb-f31554c87197.png)

title: Fixed #1201: app crash if a product link doesn't have an "HTTP" part to it
body:
## Description
If there was no "HTTP" part to a URL then the app crashed with an error "No Activity found to handle Intent". The crash happens when scheme component of the [URI](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/net/URI.html) is missing. Therefore I checked for the scheme component rather than just checking if the URL starts with "HTTP". If the scheme is null then we can safely add an "HTTP" part to it.

## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #1201 
 
 ## Screen-shots, if any
![videotogif_2018 03 12_00 34 28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10832531/37257367-73183a74-258e-11e8-97c4-853da8230951.gif)
 

 ## Checklist
 
Make sure you've done all the following (You can delete the checklist before submitting)
 
 - [x] Apply the `AndroidStyle.xml` style template to your code in Android Studio.
 - [x] Code is well documented
 - [x] Include unit tests for new functionality
 - [x] All user-visible strings are made translatable
 - [x] Code passes Travis builds in your branch
 - [x] If you have multiple commits please combine them into one commit by squashing them.
 - [x] Read and understood the contribution guidelines.

title: App crashes if a product link doesn't have an "HTTP" part to it
body:
**Checklist**
- [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search on the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting an issue.
- [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.
- [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover.

**Summary:** 
If there is a URL entered by the user and somehow he has not written the "HTTP" or the "HTTPS" part of the URL and simply wrote the website starting with "WWW" then for such cases the app crashes with an error "No Activity found to handle Intent".

**Steps to reproduce:** 
Open the link of any product from the app where the HTTP or HTTPS part is missing. For example, open [this](https://world.openfoodfacts.org/product/8908009670014/omg-oh-my-ganna-ginger-groove-nutricane) product from the app and click on its URL provided.


**Expected behavior:** 
The link should have been opened. 

**Observed behavior:** 
The app crashed.

**Screenshots:** 
![videotogif_2018 03 12_01 04 00](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10832531/37257592-a3b4dde2-2591-11e8-8196-efb73fc0ef91.gif)
