title: Convert PNGs to Vector Drawables
label: [Label(name="apk size")]
body:
## Description
Converted PNGs to vector drawables wherever possible. Also removed the unused `array` "_nav_drawer_icons_product_" from _arrays.xml_ and the drawables associated with it. This `array` was not used anywhere in the code. Thus reducing the overall apk size.

## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #1181 
 
 ## Checklist
 
Make sure you've done all the following (You can delete the checklist before submitting)
 
 - [x] Apply the `AndroidStyle.xml` style template to your code in Android Studio.
 - [x] Code is well documented
 - [x] Include unit tests for new functionality
 - [x] All user-visible strings are made translatable
 - [x] Code passes Travis builds in your branch
 - [x] If you have multiple commits please combine them into one commit by squashing them.
 - [x] Read and understood the contribution guidelines .

title: Convert PNGs to Vector Drawables
label: [Label(name="apk size")]
body:
**Checklist**
- [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search on the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting an issue.
- [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.
- [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover.

**Summary:** 
Convert PNGs to vector drawables wherever possible and thereby reducing the overall apk size. Currently we have many PNGs which can be converted to vector drawables. For instance "ic_cloud_off.png" occupies 22KB whereas converting it to vector might reduce the size to just 2KB. This way we will be able reduce the size of our apk.

title: Removes deprecated API usages and cleans up code
label: [Label(name="refactoring")]
body:
## Description

There has been a lot of deprecated API usages in the app. I have scanned the entire application for such deprecated APIs and have made corrections regarding the same. Besides, I have removed boilerplate code and made it efficient. The following are the list of APIs(deprecated) changed : -

| Existing API        | Replaced by           |
| ------------- |:-------------:| 
| `MenuItemCompat.setOnActionExpandListener()`    | `setOnActionExpandListener()` | 
| Java 7 Unambigous explicit types     | Generics      |   
| Not annotated parameters | Proper annotations     | 
|`lang3.StringEscapeUtils` | `text.StringEscapeUtils` |
|`MenuItemCompat.setShowAsAction()` | `static setShowAsAction()`|
|Anonymous Classes (jre <1.7)|lambdas|

I will be adding more commits to this PR but it is best to review simultaneously as the changes may accumulate. These changes are necessary because : 
* These hinder migration to MVVM architecture components
* Deprecated APIs have accumulated and if not upgraded now, then these will cause crashes in newer Android versions.
* These will make it easier to incorporate Kotlin in our workflow.
* Removes unnecessary code (366 - 279 = 87 lines less)

**I have been working on this for almost a week now and after scanning the code I have found a serious issue in the way we manage our Async tasks. Asynctasks in our app are non-static i.e they are nested objects within the activities. Now, if an activity gets destroyed while the execution of a background task is still pending, then the object of the Activity is not destroyed and there are references to the destroyed activity leading to memory leaks in almost every activity! This is a really serious issue and we should look into handling it.**

_Since this is a long PR I will request all the active members to review sections of the PR._

title: On SearchProductResultFragment app does not show any progress on itemClick.
label: [Label(name="search"), Label(name="ux")]
body:
**Summary:** 

On SearchProductResultFragment there is the list of search products.
Now, in low internet speed, there is no response provided to the user and the app stays still although the network requests run on the background thread.

In this way because of less information about the progress user can think that app is not giving any response on click and would click same or different product multiple times which will again trigger other network requests as well.

**Steps to reproduce:** 
During low internet speed click on any search results item.

**Expected behaviour:** 

Either any progress should be shown to the user or the app should directly go to the product page and download other information there itself.

**Observed behaviour:** 

The app does not give any response.

label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="offline")]

## Description

Inside relative layout of save_list_item.xml circular chaining of views was there which is why the bug occurred for more information  [click here.](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/23904281/circular-dependencies-cannot-exist-in-relativelayout-android)
So I've fixed this code by changing the views.

## Related issues and discussion

 ## Screen-shot:

title: Translations: Labels, Allergens, Additives, Countries, Categories.
label: [Label(name="product browsing"), Label(name="translations")]
body:
- Added new API to load multilingual labels, allergens, additives, countries and categories.
 - Created entities for all this data to store it in the local database.
 - Implemented migration to the new database
 - Created deserializers to transform JSON in POJO
 - Created the common Singleton API Manager which contains all API Services
 - Created Singleton ProductRepository to interact with server and database
 - Implemented MVP pattern for Splash screen
 - Implemented loading and saving(updating) of labels, allergens, additives, countries and categories once a day
 - Implemented displaying of translated labels, allergens, additives, countries and categories
 
- fixed bug on Preferences screen
- removed ActionBar from Splash screen

title: Languages should only be translated into their own language
label: [Label(name="translations")]
body:
**Checklist**

**Summary:** 

When choosing a language, the items should only be translated into their own language, not the language that is currently set. 

**Steps to reproduce:** 

Choose a language in prefs

**Expected behavior:** 

The items should only be translated into their own language, not the language that is currently set. 

- franais - fr
- English - en
- Espaol - es

**Observed behavior:** 

Languages are translated into language of the app.

See screenshot - I know that English is the top of the list, but I should be able to see English in English even if the app is set to Hindi. Only "Hindi" should be in Hindi

title: Fix 'preferences' crash and reformat code
body:
## Description
Changed the preference key of "FAQ" to a constant in `preferences.xml`, this was earlier used from a string resource which got translated to something else (didn't remain "FAQ") and hence a NPE was thrown in `PreferencesFragment.java` at line `faqbutton.setOnPreferenceClickListener`.
Also reformatted the file `PreferencesFragment.java`.

## Related issues and discussion
Fixes #1097

title: added break statements
body:
## Description
There were no `break;` statements after each schema change upgrade, so in our case when someone upgrades app from schema 3 to 5 the last `case :` runs two times and tries to create column two times and so the exception.
## Related issues and discussion

- [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover.

**Summary:** 


`getDaoSession()` is not static .DaoSession is currently accessed from Utils which requires a Activity argument, so it cannot be accessed in several cases like when scheduling a job.

title: Fixed #1010, fixed #375: Don't delete brand and product name if we upload an Offline product that already exists
label: [Label(name="offline")]
body:
## Description

If brand, weight, name is empty, it doesn't  send any empty parameter (like brand=&weight=&name=) 
so, now the server will not assume that we want to delete it.

Added some functions in `OpenFoodApiService` to handle such cases and also added if else statements in `post` method of `OpenFoodApiClient` to call the corresponding method in `OpenFoodApiService`.

## Related issues and discussion
closes #1010
closes #375

title: Wrong message display when connectivity is lost during search.
label: [Label(name="offline")]
body:
**Checklist**
- [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search for the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting an issue.
- [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.
- [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover.
**Summary:** 

When after loading the search results, if connectivity is lost, the app shows that the product doesn't exist in the OpenFoodFacts database. However, there should be a message showing no internet connection rather than the message that the product doesn't exist.

**Steps to reproduce:** 
1. Search for an item
2. Turn off connection
3. Click on any of the search results.

**Expected behaviour:** 
The app should display the correct behaviour i.e show no connectivity.

**Observed behaviour:** 

No such product message is shown.

**Screenshots:** 
![28642901_1613503248737652_626461977_o](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25154317/36930820-4954c5b0-1ecf-11e8-99a9-b5070bde4211.png)

title: Memory issues after Search
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="memory"), Label(name="search")]
body:
**Summary:** 

After doing a search, and scrolling a lot, the app becomes slower and unresponsive

**Steps to reproduce:** 
Search for coca, click on the first product. It loads quite fast.
Search for coca, scroll a lot to the bottom, go back to the first product. Click on it, it loads slower.
Scroll even more, do even more searches, eventually the app stops responding.

**Expected behavior:** 

Stay fast

title: Update mechanism for the in-app taxonomies
label: [Label(name="offline"), Label(name="taxonomies"), Label(name="very high impact")]
body:
As mentioned in #1019 , we want to now include multilingual taxonomies within the app for better reliability.

However, we update them regularly, and thus we must provide an update mechanism.

The zipped version of the files are located at: 

https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/categories.json
https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/labels.json
https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/additives.json
https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/countries.json
https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/allergens.json

The app should download https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/version.json and check if it has changed compared to the local version.

title: Include multilingual taxonomies as default in the app
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="offline")]
body:
We have decided to include the multilingual taxonomies as default, directly within the app, to provide a good and simplified multilingual experience.

The app should include all those files by default:

https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/categories.json
https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/labels.json
https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/additives.json
https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/countries.json
https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/allergens.json
I'm opening another bug to ensure we provide an update mechanism.

title: Replace the allergen JSON by this one
label: [Label(name="allergens"), Label(name="offline")]
body:
https://static.openfoodfacts.org/data/taxonomies/allergens.json

It is multilingual, static (thus much quicker to load), and more reliable (the Allergens are translated, thus the check can be done with all languages at once)

title: The allergen detector can only find the "top 14" common allergens - (Adding Mozzarella as an allergen doesn't work)
label: [Label(name="allergens"), Label(name="translations"), Label(name="very high impact")]
body:
Adding Mozarella as an allergen doesn't work because Mozarella isn't a common allergen and isn't in the ingredient list:
https://world.openfoodfacts.org/product/8000430133035/mozzarella-galbani

As a result, we should restrict the allergen alert to common allergens that have been translated accross languages.

title: Action Bar title is not changing when back button is pressed and app redirects to some other Fragment.
body:
**Checklist** - [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search on the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting a issue. - [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software. - [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover. **Summary:** Title at Action bar is not changing according to the fragments, when we are at a fragment and pressing back button directs us to the previous fragment(which we have visited previously) , So this time the title at action bar is not changed according to current fragment. **Steps to reproduce:** 1. Open the app and it is at HOME and action bar title is **Home** 2. Click on `Search by barcode` option in navigation Drawer. 3. Press back button of your phone. 4. Now it is at home but title is **Search by barcode** only **Expected behavior:** When the back button is pressed the title, should change accordingly. (For this case **Home** should be title of action bar when returning back to Home Fragment) **Observed behavior:** The title is unchanged when transaction happen between any to Fragments by pressing the back button. **Device :** one+ X **android version:** 6.0.1 marshmallow **Screenshots:**

First we are at home



After Pressing Search by Barcode



On pressing back button

title: Category activity keeps loading forever even if there is no connectivity.
label: [Label(name="categories")]
body:
**Checklist**
- [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search on the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting a issue.
- [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.
- [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover.
**Summary:** 

Category activity keeps loading forever even if there is no connectivity.

**Steps to reproduce:** 

Turn off network connection. Then open Categories from nav-drawer.

**Add system logs:**

NA

**Expected behavior:** 

It should show a message that there is no connection.

**Observed behavior:** 
Category activity keeps loading forever even if there is no connectivity.

title: Fixed #990 : Open FAQ in Chrome Custom Tab
body:
## Description

1. The FAQ is now opened in a chrome custom tab. 
2. The FAQ Url is extracted as a string resource .
3. The FAQ Url is made non-translatable

 ## Screen-shots, if any

title: fixes #951 Add a warning about allergen detector when a product is not complete
label: [Label(name="allergens")]
body: ## Description To get the array `states_tags` from the server I've added `states_tag` in `getFullProductByBarcode()` method's relative URL in `OpenFoodApiService` and used this to check product is complete or not in `SummaryProductFragment` if the product is incomplete a dismissable message is displayed in the UI. ## Related issues and discussion fixes #951 ## Screen-shots, if any

- Added the option to disable uploading on mobile networks
- User will be sent to offline product edit when scanning
- User will be informed of this when uploading offline products

title: fixes #877 Additives are always displayed in English while we have tr
label: [Label(name="additives")]
body:
## Description

On `PreferanceChangeListener` of **PreferencesFragment**, I've called a method `GetAdditives` which uses AsyncTask to get additives in the selected language and stores it in the **greenDao** database so that next time when a user visits **IngredientsProductFragment** he/she can see additives in the selected language.

At present only English and French translation can be seen.

## Related issues and discussion
#877

title: No runtime permissions for camera.
body:
**Checklist**
- [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search on the [issues tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating or reporting a issue.
- [x] Before reporting, please ensure (if you can) that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.
- [x] Don't forget to tag your issue, it makes it easier to discover.
**Summary:** 

The app doesn't ask for runtime permissions for the camera while scanning. It just displays the alert that permissions are not granted.

**Steps to reproduce:** 

Go to App settings and deny Camera Permissions to OpenFood Facts. Then open the app and click on the Scan Barcode nav drawer item.
**Add system logs:**
NA

Add logcat files here (if you are able to add).
NA

**Expected behavior:** 

App should ask for runtime permissions.

**Observed behavior:** 

No runtime permissions are requested.

**Screenshots:** 
![test](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25154317/36715329-ce841d60-1bbb-11e8-95c5-41e5f1702c9d.png)

body:

- Search by barcode

- Offline edit

**Steps to reproduce:** 

Go to the section. Press back button. 

**Expected behavior:** 

Go to home

**Observed behavior:** 

Activity closes

title: Closes #173 Added ability to rotate and crop images (before sending)
label: [Label(name="image upload")]
body:
## Description

**Android Image Cropper Library** is used to implement the functionality of Cropping and Rotation of images.
 
https://github.com/ArthurHub/Android-Image-Cropper

**This feature is implemented in following Activities or Fragments:**

- SaveProductOfflineActivity
- NutritionInfoProductFragment
- IngredientsProductFragment
- SummaryProductFragment

In `SaveProductOfflineActivity` Chrisbanes Photoview is used instead of ImageView for better user experience.

## Related issues and discussion
Closes #173 
 
 ## Screen-shots, if any

![demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25099208/36696121-5a6100b2-1b69-11e8-8c67-c0c962734ef7.gif)

title: Labels are always displayed in French, although we have translations for them.
label: [Label(name="multilingual products"), Label(name="product browsing")]
body:
Labels are always displayed in French, although we have translations for them.

1.Display Labels in user language if available
2.Otherwise display Labels in English if available
3.Otherwise display Labels in the product main's language

https://world.openfoodfacts.org/labels.json
https://world-fr.openfoodfacts.org/labels.json

title: Allow to change the display language of a product
label: [Label(name="multilingual products"), Label(name="product browsing")]
body:
Many products on Open Food Facts are multilingual:
they have a main language, their ingredients, name, common name are typed into several languages.
They have an ingredient/nutrition/front picture for several languages.

Make it possible to change the display language of a product.
https://world.openfoodfacts.org/language/multilingual/state/complete

https://world-fr.openfoodfacts.org/product/20267605/noix-de-cajou-alesto
https://world-es.openfoodfacts.org/product/20267605/noix-de-cajou-alesto

title: In AlertUserFragment all the allergens need to be shown in every language.
label: [Label(name="allergens")]
body:
We should look for all translations of an allergen, in all available languages on the product. This might yield false positives but will be safer than the current implementation.

Please ask for more clarification if needed.

title: fixes #930 In AlertUserFragment we're only abstracting english and  french allergens from AllergenDao
label: [Label(name="allergens")]
body:
## Description

Fixes #930 and also optimised the code little bit as in previous code `Locale.getDefault().getLanguage()` was called for each element of  AllergenDao so instead of this it is now called just one time before starting of the loop.

**Example of languages which are in AllergenDao and are not used before:**
Italian, German, Japanese, Russian, etc.

## Related issues and discussion
#930

title: fixes #917 App is getting crash due to java.lang.RuntimeException on
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
fixes #917 

**Changes in this PR:**

 For AppCompat library, it's necessary to call `requestFeature()` before `super.onCreate()`
So, `requestWindowFeature(Window.FEATURE_NO_TITLE)` is called before ` super.onCreate()`

ON pressing cancel button in camera selection mode (i.e rear of front) in scanning with barcode option pauses the camera instead of taking back to it's previous state as no change is selected.

By clicking cancel option in camera selection mode of scanning with barcode in slide bar menu.

Going back to same state of camera as no change is selected.

It pauses the camera

Redmi Note 4 having android 7.0 (nougat)

2. Choose the "Select camera" option in toolbar

Actual result: the camera preview is frozen, there is no ability to scan bar code.
Expected result: camera preview is working, there is ability to scan bar code.

title: Replacing anonymous classes with lambdas.
label: [Label(name="assigned"), Label(name="refactoring")]
body:
With the addition of JAVA 8, it is advised to use lambdas over anonymous classes for implementation of functional interfaces.

**Steps to reproduce:** 

NA

**Add system logs:**

NA

**Expected behaviour:** 

It is better if lambdas are more frequently used. Major benefit being runtime invocation of lambdas leading to smaller APk (avoids compile-time creation of anonymous .class files).

**Observed behaviour:** 

Instead of using anonymous classes it is better to switch to lambdas for implementing functional interfaces.

**Device and Android version:** 
NA
**Screenshots:** 

NA

###### Are you interested to work on this issue?
Yes

title: Allergen detector doesn't work
label: [Label(name="allergens"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="very high impact")]
body:
I tried adding Mozarella as an additive. 

-It doesn't work for a product in German (that is Mozarella, but contains Milch)
- It doesn't work for a mozarella product in French that contains Mozarella in ingredients.

My UX is in English.

We should disable it completely until it's reliable

title: Let people share images with barcodes to Open Food Facts
label: [Label(name="product addition")]
body:
Sometimes people don't have the time to open the app and properly scan a product. Instead, they take  2 or 3 photos of the product, including one with the barcode. Let the people add those pictures to Open Food Facts, and then open a wizard to help them add those pictures to an existing product or create  a new product, based on the case.

If the user only selects one image, it should ensure he has no more additional pictures he can share

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1689815/36557401-6f75311c-1808-11e8-9e75-21c2894c7fb7.png)

title: Create SETUP_GUIDELINES.md
body: ## Description Created setup guidelines to help new developers contribute to the project. ## Related issues and discussion #865 ## Screen-shots, if any

title: Setup Guidelines for Developers
body:
1 . I have observed that many people face trouble in correctly setting up their development environment leading to problems in pull requests . 
2. There are people who are capable of contributing but do not know how to setup their development environment due to lack of knowledge of GitHub and Git . 

It would be good if we create setup guidelines for developers  so that they can focus on contributing and worry less about configuring , branching etc.

title: Remove "no data" toast from offline edit fragment
label: [Label(name="contribution"), Label(name="easy fix"), Label(name="offline")]
body:
**Avoid reporting a duplicate**
- [x] Bug Report - The issue you are reporting might be there already. Please search on the [issue tracker](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues) before creating reporting a issue.
   - Also before reporting please ensure that you have tested it with the latest (dev) version of the software.

**Summary:** 

When opening the offline edit fragment in the app, if there is no entries there, then there is a toast displayed with "no data". This should be removed in replace of a view being added into the center of the page. This view should tell the user that there are no offline products.

**Steps to reproduce:** 

Open the "offline edit" fragment.

**Expected behavior:** 

The app should inform the user that there are no products to display. However, there should be a view there instead of a toast, this view should always be visible when the user is in the fragment and there is no information to display.

**Observed behavior:** 

A toast is displayed.

**Device and Android version:** 

OnePlus 5T Android 8

title: Add curved picture mode
label: [Label(name="camera"), Label(name="contribution")]
body:
For some products, it's impossible to take the whole ingredient list in a single time because it is curved.

A Curved picture mode would tell the user to take 3 pictures (left middle and right) so that we can process it server side.

Here's an example from a French app

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1689815/36494219-c470723a-1731-11e8-9801-96b83b8e9b31.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1689815/36494241-d124005a-1731-11e8-99c3-9f3b1a3c71b9.png)

title: Shortcut icons are Bitmaps instead of VectorDrawables
label: [Label(name="graphic assets")]
body:
Please replace the shortcuts bitmaps icons introduced in PR #792 by VectorDrawables. 

As an example, you can use layer-list to combine the required elements (grayed circle in the back and a referenced drawable on top of it):

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<layer-list xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android">
    <item>
        <!-- drawable/circle_card_icon.xml -->
        <shape xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
            android:shape="oval">
            <solid android:color="#eee"/>
            <size
                android:width="24dp"
                android:height="24dp"
                />
        </shape>
    </item>
    <item android:drawable="@drawable/ic_search_black" />
</layer-list>
```
Change the sizes, colors as required to replicate the ones used currently. 

**Note**: Not an issue, but a suggested improvement

title: Forever loading on SplashScreen on OffDebug Variant
label: [Label(name="Nougat"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="splash screen"), Label(name="very high impact")]
body:
**Summary:** 
The Splash Screen Keeps on Loading on `OffDebug` Variant 

**Steps to reproduce:** 
1 choose offDebug as your build variant
2 Build and run the variant on 7.1 Android 
3 Splash Screen with LoadToast is showing indeterminately. 

**Add System logs:**
There's no Error 
Only a bunch of Database create calls. 
**Expected behavior:** 
The App should run fine on android 7.1

**Observed behavior:** 
I checked further and got that it Leads to GetJson Asynktask to execute and get the json value. 
Afterwards it runs the preexecute and Doinbackground Perfectly but gets stucked on PostExecute. 
![device-2018-02-18-045801](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25671488/36346688-44a0b7d8-1469-11e8-84ca-e039bdc10901.png)
![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25671488/36346687-44559e92-1469-11e8-872d-a4b2471bfdb0.png)
![screenshot from 2018-02-18 04-59-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25671488/36346689-44e6ec6c-1469-11e8-830a-98c8fccf9d49.png)

**Device and Android version:** 
Android 7.1
*Yes, I would like to work on this issue*

title: fix #571 Resources$NotFoundException: File res/drawable-hdpi-v4/error
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
## Description

The bug was present because `VectorDrawableCompat.create()` was not able to load imageDrawable of `nutrientLevelItem.getIcon()` so that's why `setImageResource()` is used to fix the issue.

## Related issues and discussion
#571

title: fixes compatibility and png issues
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
fixes compatibility and png issues

compatibility below 21

## Description

As ` android:drawableRight` is not compatible with lower versions I added custom text view and custom button view to make `app:drawableRightCompat` which is compatible. 
`VectorDrawableCompat.create()` cannot load png images it will only inflate vector drawables, so when png is encountered it throws an error. 
This is resolved using `AppCompatDrawable.getDrawable()` . For more info [see here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40241018/appcompatdrawablemanager-get-vs-vectordrawablecompat-create).

## Related issues and discussion
closes #753
closes #571
closes #621 
 
 ## Checklist

 - [x] Apply the `AndroidStyle.xml` style template to your code in Android Studio.
 
 - [x] If you have multiple commits please combine them into one commit by squashing them.
 
 - [x] Read and understood the contribution guidelines .

title: login issue
label: [Label(name="login")]
body:
## Description

Variable ```userAccountUri``` was not updated after user was logged in so I updated that variable while getting userdata after user logged in. Sharedpreference ```.apply()``` method runs in background, so the preference was not getting updated by the time ```getUserProfile()``` was called in ```logout()``` function.So I updated ```.apply()``` to ```.commit()``` so that the Navigation drawer header will get changed after logging out.

## Related issues and discussion
#756 
 
 ## Checklist
  
 - [x] Apply the `AndroidStyle.xml` style template to your code in Android Studio.
 
 - [x] If you have multiple commits please combine them into one commit by squashing them.
 
 - [x] Read and understood the contribution guidelines .

title: fix #Bug on getting back from findProductFragment to homeFragment
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
## Description

On the current version of app, this issue arises because on **fragmentTransaction from HomeFragment** to **SearchedProductFragment** `addToBackStack()` method is used which adds searchedProductFragment to stack, so that's why when we come back to homeFragment and do transition to other fragments the respective bug occurs. On removing the use of this method `addToBackStack()` this bug is solved.

## Related issues and discussion
#731

label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
## Description

Implementation of chrisbanes PhotoView Library's PhotoView is used in place of imageView.
as in pull request #725 the bug was solved using imageView but still, we require more functionalities like

- Out of the box zooming, using multi-touch and double-tap.
- Scrolling, with smooth scrolling fling.

Related issues and discussion
#734 
#709

title: fix #728 bug during search
Add SerialVersionUID to Nutriments.java
body:
fix https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/issues/569


Helpful articles  at :- https://dzone.com/articles/what-is-serialversionuid?fromrel=true 
And  https://javapapers.com/core-java/serialversionuid-in-java-serialization/ 

It's a basic need so we don't get `InvalidClassException`

This PR  solves  Error `The serializable class Nutriments does not declare a static final serialVersionUID field of type long`

on pressing back it takes out from app .

Android 7.0 ,API 24

title: Back button is not working in sign in & sign up activity
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="login")]
body:

when we pres back button in sign up and sign activity is don't goes back .

**Steps to reproduce:** 

1. open app --->choose sign in from navbar 
2.  press back button 

**Expected behaviour:** 

on pressing back buttons user should back to mainActivity .

**Device and Android version:** 
Android  7.0 ,API 24

title: Add CodeTriage badge to openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp
body:
Adds a badge showing the number of people helping this repo on CodeTriage.

[![Open Source Helpers](https://www.codetriage.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/badges/users.svg)](https://www.codetriage.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp)


## What is CodeTriage?

CodeTriage is an Open Source app that is designed to make contributing to Open Source projects easier. It works by sending subscribers a few open issues in their inbox. If subscribers get busy, there is an algorithm that backs off issue load so they do not get overwhelmed

[Read more about the CodeTriage project](https://www.codetriage.com/what).

## Why am I getting this PR?

Your project was picked by the human, @schneems. They selected it from the projects submitted to https://www.codetriage.com and hand edited the PR. How did your project get added to [CodeTriage](https://www.codetriage.com/what)? Roughly 8 months ago, [everestbt](https://github.com/everestbt) added this project to CodeTriage in order to start contributing. Since then, 7 people have subscribed to help this repo.

## What does adding a badge accomplish?

Adding a badge invites people to help contribute to your project. It also lets developers know that others are invested in the longterm success and maintainability of the project.

You can see an example of a CodeTriage badge on these popular OSS READMEs:

- [![](https://www.codetriage.com/rails/rails/badges/users.svg)](https://www.codetriage.com/rails/rails) https://github.com/rails/rails
- [![](https://www.codetriage.com/crystal-lang/crystal/badges/users.svg)](https://www.codetriage.com/crystal-lang/crystal) https://github.com/crystal-lang/crystal

## Have a question or comment?

While I am a bot, this PR was manually reviewed and monitored by a human - @schneems. My job is writing commit messages and handling PR logistics.

If you have any questions, you can reply back to this PR and they will be answered by @schneems. If you do not want a badge right now, no worries, close the PR, you will not hear from me again.

Thanks for making your project Open Source! Any feedback is greatly appreciated.

title: Add Installation Script install.sh
body:
**Issues Faced**
1.Installation failed due to insufficient permission on running easy_install android2po
2. a2po COMMAND --android myproject/res --gettext myproject/locale gives 

**Log**
1.error: can't create or remove files in install directory
The following error occurred while trying to add or remove files in the
installation directory:
    [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/test-easy-install-26480.write-test'
The installation directory you specified (via --install-dir, --prefix, or
the distutils default setting) was:
    /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/

2.ImportError: No module named termcolor
**Steps to Reproduce**
3. After installing from sudo pip install termcolor it gives this error
a2po: error: argument command: invalid choice: 'COMMAND' (choose from u'import', u'init', u'export')
Add installation script install.sh and update the readme

title: Issue 698 fix
body:
This PR uses the built in language display names instead of the translatable definitions in i10n strings (issue #698) 

`values-*/strings.xml` files have been fixed using the following shell snippet: 

```
for i in $(grep -l -R images_array values-*); do
 sed -i -e '/string-array name=\"lang_array\"/,/string-array name=\"images_array\"/{//!d;}' -e '/string-array name=\"lang_array\"'/d $i;
done
```

title: Put the nutriscore in the Summary tab, below product name
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="product browsing")]
body:
Put the nutriscore in the Summary tab, below product name
Most people want it first, as a nutrition summary, and it's the killer feature of V1

The code is in the Nutrition tab. Duplicate it. Don't remove it from the nutrition tab. We can live with the nutriscore being displayed twice :-)

title: Issue 677
body: This PR fix Issue #677 by increasing read timeouts from 10 to 30 seconds. The categories client does not use the OFF Api client so I've increased both client's timeouts just in case (as other functionalities pulling big JSON streams from the DB might fail the same way)

Noticed this issue when working on the activity. Please ignore the lack of camera button as this is relevant to PR #686. There appears to be two titles for the nutrition images, with the "Take nutrition image" should not be there. This may be confusing to some users.

These titles are also hardcoded in `activity_save_product_offline.xml`.

![screenshot_20180130-173211](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5596450/35581548-04d1c658-05e4-11e8-8fda-0fcef00d1d59.png)

title: Chromebook support, and support for devices with no hardware camera
body:
# Chromebook support
Added simple support for Chromebooks by editing the manifest to allow the app to be installed on devices that do not have a touchscreen.

# Devices without Cameras (#534)
Added support for devices without cameras.

- Added changes to AndroidManifest to no longer need a camera to install on the device
- Added checks to hide "take photos" or "scan" buttons when there is no camera on the device
- Drawer "Scan barcode" item is hidden if there is no camera detected on the device

title: Feature/650 category browser - PART 1
body:
The first part contains the network call to categories endpoint, parsing and displaying the categories list.
Some improvement and new libraries are added within this PR:
RxJava : Reactive programming
Dagger : Dependency injection
Enabling data binding to migrate to MVVM
Upgrading dependencies.

![demo](https://thumbs.gfycat.com/WickedAfraidHawaiianmonkseal-size_restricted.gif)

title: The Storage Permission is asked at the wrong time
label: [Label(name="priority")]
body:
The Storage Permission is asked at the wrong time, and thus scary. It is asked when you land on an existing product page.

**Why would I possibly need the storage permission to view a product ?**

- We only need it when **adding a new product from images already on the device**. 
- Otherwise, **if adding a new product from the camera, we only need the camera**.
- **If adding additional photos to an existing product**, we can show the permission request **when the users clicks on the "Add more photos" button**

title: Reenable a test that was failing in OpenFoodAPIServiceTest.java
Add Pastec.io support to the App
label: [Label(name="feature"), Label(name="scanning")]
body:
We're going to replace Moodstocks by Pastec.io, since Moodstocks is deprecated.
The doc is here:
http://pastec.io/doc/oss/
```
Search request

This call performs a search in the index thanks to a request image. It returns the id of the matched images from the most to the least relevant ones.

Request JPEG images with a size approximately equal to 450x340 pixels and a 75% quality are usally enough to achieve a good matching. Their small size allows to quickly send them over a mobile network.

Path: /index/searcher
HTTP method: POST
Data: the binary data of the request image compressed in JPEG
Answer: "SEARCH_RESULTS" as type field and a list of the the matched image ids from the most to the least relevant one in the "image_ids" field
Possible error types: "IMAGE_NOT_DECODED", "IMAGE_SIZE_TOO_BIG", "IMAGE_SIZE_TOO_SMALL"
Example:
Command line:
curl -X POST --data-binary @/home/test/img/request.jpg http://localhost:4212/index/searcher
Answer:
{
   "image_ids" : [ 2, 5, 43 ],
   "type" : "SEARCH_RESULTS"
}

```

title: L10n master
Send an anonymized hash with each contribution non-logged in device
label: [Label(name="quality of contributions")]
body:
Send an anonymized hash for each non-logged in device so that we can block any spammer or bad-meaning person server side.
It has to remain the same across contributions, but shouldn't contain any information that could let anyone trace back to the user.
Strongly hashing a uuid might be an option. We need to add a secret string to further protect against any rainbow tables of hashed uuids that might exist on the internet.
Perhaps Android has a native mechanism for that.

title: Perform on the fly OCR on front and ingredient images
label: [Label(name="contribution"), Label(name="feature"), Label(name="ocr"), Label(name="very high impact")]
body:
1. Taking a photo of ingredients
2. Cropping it and indicating language
3. The image is sent to the Open Food Facts server which forwards it to Google Cloud Vision for processing
4. If the image contains NSFW content, a special response is sent
5. Otherwise, text and annotations are received by the app and displayed for correction.

different use case to make OBF/OPFF/OFF crash
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
hi there,

a few weeks ago, versions bigger than 0.4 didn't run at all.
Now, with the version 7.xx, it does:
 * run,
 * scan,
 * add unknown items

Before running test, I clean application data.
I go to OBF search page, type "a", open first ingredient, go ingredient tab, it works.
I go to OPFF search page, type "a", open first ingredient, go ingredient tab, it **crashes**.
I go to OFF search page, type "a", open first ingredient, go ingredient tab, it works.

I go to OBF login, it show the form, I quit.
I go to OPFF login, it show the form, I quit.
I go to OFF login, it **crashes**.

I go to OBF login, it show the form, I connect, it works and I see my username in the side panel.
I go to OPFF login, it show the form, I connect, it works by I don't see my username in the side panel, instead I see anonymous, but it still shows one previous contribution (3222270494083) which isn't mine (I have none with this login).
I go to OFF login, it **crashes**.

thanks for your help

NB: I use the same login/password in all apps.

title: Fix #378 (clean some of the product strings after deserialization)
body:
Uses Apache Commons StringEscapeUtils, which may possibly not be accurate/efficient enough. If this becomes an issue, using a third-party library such as unbescape (https://github.com/unbescape/unbescape) could be preferrable.

We may also want to clean some or all of the other strings.

title: Fix #419 (ingredients label not bolded)
Add ingredient analysis for Open Beauty Facts
label: [Label(name="Open Beauty Facts"), Label(name="api-update-required"), Label(name="feature"), Label(name="priority")]
body:
In Open Beauty Facts, we display an ingredient analysis on the web version.
To provide value in the mobile app, we need to display this analysis (once available in the API).

**Ingredients analysis:**
```
- Without Parabens
- Without Formaldehyde releasers
- With Allergenic fragrances
- Without Silicones
- Without Phenoxyethanol
- Without Triclosan
- Without Cetrimonium bromide
- Without Methylisothiazolinone
- Without Aluminum salts
```

title: Ensure we work well with 18:9 aspect ratios
label: [Label(name="assets"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="ux")]
body:
https://android-developers.googleblog.com/2017/03/update-your-app-to-take-advantage-of.html

```
In order to take full advantage of the larger display formats on these devices, you should consider increasing your app's maximum supported aspect ratio. To do so, simply declare an android.max_aspect <meta-data> element in the app's <application> element:

<meta-data android:name="android.max_aspect"
    android:value="ratio_float"/>

ratio_float
Maximum aspect ratio your app can support, expressed as (longer dimension / shorter dimension) in decimal form. 

We recommend that you design your app to support aspect ratios of 2.1 or higher. For this, you would add the following to the <application> element: 

<meta-data android:name="android.max_aspect" android:value="2.1" />
Note: if you don't set a value, and android:resizeableActivity is not true, then the maximum aspect ratio defaults to 1.86 (roughly 16:9) and your app will not take advantage of the extra screen space.

As more super widescreen Android devices, like the Samsung Galaxy S8 and the LG G6, become available, you'll have more opportunities to display more content and create more engaging experiences with your app. 

For more details about how to support multiple screens on Android, please visit the page Supporting Multiple Screens.
```

title: Make the product addition form look like an empty product
label: [Label(name="product addition"), Label(name="very high impact")]
body:
- It should look like an empty product
- It should try to send pictures as soon as they are taken (or later if offline mode is enabled)
- It should let people add product name and brand
- It should not have an explicit save button : people wanting to add text should add it by editing and saving.

title: Add a message saying only 1 photo is compulsory
label: [Label(name="product addition"), Label(name="very high impact")]
body:
Add a message saying only 1 photo is compulsory

"You don't have to fill all the info right now. Just 1 photo required."

title: Excessive capabilities for Amazon devices
label: [Label(name="Amazon devices")]
body:
```
Your APK manifest requires capabilities not present on this device. Learn more
android.hardware.camera.autofocus
android:minSdkVersion = '16'; device requires '15'
```
Excessive capabilities for Amazon devices. Can we perhaps do a flavor for the Amazon app store where the minSdkVersion is lower, and the autofocus not required ?

Clicking on the scan button when you arrived from the history brings back to history.
It should open the scan window instead.

Contact @teolemon for details

body: @herau @itchix About translations, only changed translations of en(en-rgb,en-rau).

title: Fixed Issue #415
body: @herau @itchix

title: use barcode icon to scan for barcodes, not the camera icon
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="ux")]
body:
Currently the interface looks something link this:

> ## Search
> ![Barcode] Search by Barcode
> ![Camera] Scan
> ![History] History

Now what I tap without thinking, when I intent to scan a barcode is the ![Barcode] icon 

When I see ![Camera] I think of permanently photographing something. Technically the phone utilizes the camera to scan a barcode but I think in my head it is a different application.

I propose the change it like this:

> ## Search
> ![Dialpad] type barcode
> ![Barcode] scan barcode
> ![History] History

[Camera]: https://storage.googleapis.com/material-icons/external-assets/v4/icons/svg/ic_photo_camera_black_24px.svg
[Dialpad]: https://storage.googleapis.com/material-icons/external-assets/v4/icons/svg/ic_dialpad_black_24px.svg
[Barcode]: https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-androidapp/blob/master/app/src/main/res/drawable-xhdpi/ic_barcode_black_18dp.png?raw=true
[History]: https://storage.googleapis.com/material-icons/external-assets/v4/icons/svg/ic_history_black_24px.svg

title: (Obsolete) fork for obf
Change app icons

![openbeautyfacts round](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1689815/23542718/086e95a8-ffef-11e6-9c9d-f04762bed735.png)

title: Make it possible to ban list of ingredients
label: [Label(name="allergens"), Label(name="feature")]
body:
Make it possible to ban list of ingredients, as a first step towards proper diet support.

We could 
- create several predefined lists, with a clear warning that they might not be exhaustive.
- ask for feedback (please send feedback or ingredients that are missing to email@app.com)

- without gluten
- without palm oil
- vegan
- vegetarian
- without pork
- pregnancy

title: Using Wikidata Toolkit Java Library to enrich facets in the app
label: [Label(name="feature"), Label(name="wikidata")]
body:
Many facets of Open Food Facts (categories, labels) are linked to Wikidata, which is linked to Wikipedia.

Thus, by getting the Wikidata ID from the API, we can get Wikidata info we can display, and links to Wikipedia, so that the users can get more knowledge: controversies about additives, more info about the wine they are drinking

https://github.com/Wikidata/Wikidata-Toolkit

title: F-Droid version crashes upon loading
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I just installed Open Food from F-Droid (Version 0.5 - Added on 2017-01-14) on my Android 4.4.2 and I can't use it. I open the app, the splash image with the logo appears and then an Android system error message tells me the app has crashed.

Any ideas?

title: burst mode
label: [Label(name="feature"), Label(name="ux")]
body:
It seems to me that the current ui is based on the assumption that a users carefully create a _complete_ product entry on their phones. At least the for me that does not work. 

I am usually taking four or five random photos of the product with little or no information. I don't want to be forced to decide if I'm now taking a _front_, _nutrition_ or _ingredients_ picture. Also I am taking photos of labels and interesting text passages. I am in hurry. I am socialising. I want to get out of the supermarket as quick as possible.  All of these photos are just notes for later. 

The rest of the work I'm doing at home in my armchair when I am not in a hurry. 

Thats why the legacy app works much better for me. 

If there'd be a _quick add_ or _burst mode_ function that only lets one take a bunch of pictures and roughly _tag_ them for later, that would work well for me.

title: Crunch PNG Files
label: [Label(name="apk size")]
body:
The aapt tool can optimize the image resources placed in res/drawable/ with lossless compression during the build process. For example, the aapt tool can convert a true-color PNG that does not require more than 256 colors to an 8-bit PNG with a color palette. Doing so results in an image of equal quality but a smaller memory footprint.

Keep in mind that the aapt has the following limitations:

The aapt tool does not shrink PNG files contained in the asset/ folder.
Image files need to use 256 or fewer colors for the aapt tool to optimize them.
The aapt tool may inflate PNG files that have already been compressed. To prevent this, you can use the cruncherEnabled flag in Gradle to disable this process for PNG files:
```
aaptOptions {
    cruncherEnabled = false
}
```
https://developer.android.com/topic/performance/reduce-apk-size.html

label: [Label(name="feature"), Label(name="product addition"), Label(name="scanning")]
body:
Enable scanning a barcode from an image selected from the photoroll
**Use case:** 
- a user (like @tacitefood) has taken many product photos (usually photo of barcode, then several photos)
- he should be able to select a photo with a barcode
- the app should detect the barcode in the image, and switch to the classic add new product view (or to the product if it exists) to let him do further work (like add the other images)

title: Extend additives system to all languages using the Open Food Facts API
label: [Label(name="additives"), Label(name="priority")]
body:
Extend additives system to all languages using the Open Food Facts API instead of the current CSV files that only cover English and French.

That will be a regression for the toxicity level, but those are not sourced, and not scalable in terms of languages.

https://world.openfoodfacts.org/additives.json
https://fr.openfoodfacts.org/additifs.json

(Those can be put in translatable strings to get the proper URL)

```{"products":7434,"id":"en:e330","name":"E330 - Acide citrique","url":"https://fr.openfoodfacts.org/additif/e330-acide-citrique"}```

```
- E330 - Acide citrique
- E120 - Acide carminique
```
We should display ```name``` and open in a Chrome Custom tab the facet, to make up for the disparition of the ranking.

title: New proposed UX for allergen detector
label: [Label(name="allergens"), Label(name="ux")]
body:
New UX to add an allergen, stolen from ConsoReglo

![screenshot_20161106-200504](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1689815/21387414/d87681a8-c777-11e6-88d5-378b3b149705.png)

title: Scan button not intuitive
label: [Label(name="easy fix"), Label(name="ux")]
body:
On the new home screen, I find the new "red camera button" not very intuitive. Nothing says it's the button to scan a barcode, instead it now looks like it takes a picture, which is not exactly its function. 
In my opinion a button with "scan", a barcode logo or anything like this would be clearer, especially for a new user.

title: Additives inconsistencies between app and website
label: [Label(name="additives"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
I noticed the additives were now in red in the ingredients list, probably to match their "toxicity". Maybe the problem is not new but anyway now it says many additives are toxic, when on the website it's not.
Also, the additive E160aii  is not displayed at all in the app.

Example with the product 3103220033371 (https://fr.openfoodfacts.org/produit/3103220033371/tagada-l-originale-haribo) (sorry it's in french) :
Additive - Website dangerosity   - App dangerosity
E428      -               /                   -  Modrment toxique
E330      - peu ou pas dangereux - Modrment toxique
E100      - pas ou peu de risques - Modrment toxique
E120      - risques modrs         - Douteux
E160aii   -               /                   - Not displayed in the app

So basically everything in this example is in red and it seems I'm going to die if I eat it!

title: Picture is opened stretched
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="product browsing")]
body:
When you tap a picture in the product view (product, ingredients or nutrition tab), it's displayed stretched to fill the screen. Then if you tap and try to "slide" it a little or zoom in, it comes back in a right way.

Note that the issue was not present in the last version, when the open / zoom was implemented first.

title: Add a material touch to the history
label: [Label(name="history"), Label(name="ux")]
body:
Use cards with square edges instead of rounded ones

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1689815/21926244/3c0f6336-d981-11e6-808f-a4e60670e62a.png)

title: Front photo disappears before send
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="offline"), Label(name="product addition")]
body:
I was in offline mode yesterday in the subway, and tried to add a can of beer I found, as a demo.
- Took front,
- Took nutrition
- Tried to hit send. Popup: you're lacking an image.
- Switch back to nutrition. The front pic had disappeared, had to retake it before sending

title: On a new product page, Photos just taken locally are not displayed
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="priority"), Label(name="product addition")]
body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Add a new product
2. You land on the new product page
3. The photos are not loaded, resulting in the empty grey dot. 
4. The "no image" pixelated cross is present on the history.
5. Moving within the app eventually fixes it.

title: Ensure we are the referrer in Chrome custom tab
label: [Label(name="chrome-custom-tab"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
As quoted in the Chrome Custom Tab guidelines:
```Add your app as the referrer
It's usually very important for websites to track where their traffic is coming from. Make sure you let them know you are sending them users by setting the referrer when launching your Custom Tab```

intent.putExtra(Intent.EXTRA_REFERRER, 
        Uri.parse(Intent.URI_ANDROID_APP_SCHEME + "//" + context.getPackageName()));

title: Ingredient list not properly bolded
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="priority")]
body: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1689815/21786065/848dea72-d6c2-11e6-9678-240611abceec.png)

title: Bigger pictures in the product view
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="product browsing")]
body:
First of all, I like the new display of the product view in the 0.4 version, I think it's much better with each picture in its corresponding tab. The fact we can tap on the pic and zoom in is really great too. 

But I think currently, some improvents could be done to the layout :
- The photos are quite small, and I think some space is wasted. For example, the ingredients picture is often very "horizontal", and could be larger, making it more readable without taking much more vertical space.
- The same goes with the product main picture : when it's mainly vertical, it seems right, but when it's very large horizontally it looks like it could be bigger.
- Some space is wasted between the product picture and the product name.
- The framing could be thinner too, saving some space.

I took the liberty to illustrate with some edited screenshots.
Hoping it's not too complicated to do what I propose :)

![ingredients before-after](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19469836/21755970/4071d706-d61b-11e6-89d7-77630d0ac047.png)
![ingredients too small](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19469836/21756080/b152ff9e-d61c-11e6-8e8e-7ed374b58f2c.png)
![product before-after](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19469836/21756031/297336a2-d61c-11e6-8954-26f822190935.png)

title: Freeze when we dont want to add the product
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
When prompted if I want to add the product when I scan a new one, if I tap no, the view freezes with the image of the barcode being scanned. You can press the back button though and you're back to the home view.
I think the expected behaviour when you tap "no" is to go back to the scanning view to scan another product.

Note that I took a barcode that was not on food, because I have no food to scan right now, but I doubt the result would be different. I'll test when I can with food.

- If a barcode is detected, display a notification offering to add the product to Open Food Facts

label: [Label(name="feature"), Label(name="product addition")]
body:
- Add a service that monitors the photoroll and does local photo detection in new photos
- If a food packaging is detected, display a notification offering to add the product to Open Food Facts
- Ask for a barcode, a name, a brand and a weight.
- Add a tick box: "This product has no barcode"

title: Front facing camera not working
label: [Label(name="camera"), Label(name="feature")]
body:
- I installed latest trunk on a cheap testing tablet device with only a front facing camera.
- I don't expect it be to actually be able to scan barcodes (too shitty quality, and no autofocus)
- When trying to scan, it displays a view without the camera, and properly lists the front camera as the main source.

It should : 
- properly display the front camera stream
- warn me under certain circumstances (front camera, no autofocus, low resolution) that I can still lookup products using the lookup by barcode feature.

Check that name, brand and weight/weight_unit are empty before writing. Overwise, don't overwrite them.

title: Fat unit not displayed
label: [Label(name="api-update-required"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="product browsing")]
body:
For the product 3017620429484 (http://fr.openfoodfacts.org/produit/3017620429484/nutella-ferrero), the fat unit "g" is not displayed in the nutrition tab : it just show `fat : high (31.6)`. 
I searched for other products with this issue but found only this one for now.

title: Show last edit date on product
label: [Label(name="feature"), Label(name="priority"), Label(name="product browsing")]
body: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1689815/21977646/50dbbb68-dbd7-11e6-89d7-d412fa531752.png)

title: "Back" behavior is not consistent
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
When you are in a view with a "back" button in the top left (left arrow), the "back" Android button does not do the same thing as tapping the top left button. Sorry if it's not clear, I don't know the proper terms in english, if they exist.

Steps to reproduce :
- Search for a product in the search view. The result list appears.
- Open a product view. Now the "back" top left button is present.
  - If you tap this button, you're redirected to the home view (with the "Scan" button).
  - But if you tap the physical "back" button of the smartphone, you're redirected to the previous result list.

I don't know if this is the intended behavior, but it's disturbing. For me the convenient solution is to redirect to the result list, even if you tap the left arrow in the app.

label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="product browsing")]

title: Pictures are stretched in the history list
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="history")]
body:
In the history list, the product pictures are stretched (if the picture is not a square). 
I think it should be displayed the same way as in the result list when you search a product by name, kind of "zoomed in" for the picture to fill in the thumbnail square.

title: Wrong french label for the brand
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
If the language is set to french, in the main product view the brand is displayed as "Magasins" but it should be "Marques".
The real store label is correct, so currently 2 labels are called "Magasins".

To be clear, in french :
Stores = Magasins
Brands = Marques

title: French translation issues
body:
In the french version, several things are displayed in english instead of french :
In the left menu : 
"History" -> "Historique" ;
"Preferences" -> "Prfrences" (with accents)

Also the preference screen is totally in english and should be translated.

Bonus : in the top right button, "Contributer" should be "Contribuer" in french.

title: App crashes when camera permission is off.
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
When the "Camera" permission is revoked, app crashes after clicking on "TAKE PICTURE" button in the page for adding the information of a product. (The clip of reproducible bug scenario is attached)

![openfood](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11197005/20986980/b32e21ec-bc7f-11e6-8f3e-3bd7317d1dbb.gif)

I believe the APIs for checking(checkSelfPermission)/asking(requestPermissions) CAMERA permission should get called.

Here is the stack trace after the crash:

```

title: App crashes upon loading a scanned product or on search by barcode
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="local-database"), Label(name="question"), Label(name="sql")]
body:
I had this issue on my phone (Samsung S5 mini, Lollipop), on the application installed from the store, but also on the app built locally from sources and deployed in dev mode, on the phone (but also in the simulator)

It reproduced like this:
Case 1:
* open the app
* hit scan
* App says "Loading", after a while application crashes.

Case 2: 
* open the app
* click search by barcode
* type a correct bar code and send
* App says "Loading", after a while the application crashes.

The logs I had in the console, were always similar to this:
```
E/AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: main
                 Process: openfoodfacts.github.scrachx.openfood, PID: 595
                 android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: no such table: HISTORY_PRODUCT (code 1): , while compiling: SELECT * FROM HISTORY_PRODUCT WHERE barcode = ?
                 #################################################################
                 Error Code : 1 (SQLITE_ERROR)
                 Caused By : SQL(query) error or missing database.
                     (no such table: HISTORY_PRODUCT (code 1): , while compiling: SELECT * FROM HISTORY_PRODUCT WHERE barcode = ?)
                 #################################################################
                     at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteConnection.nativePrepareStatement(Native Method)
                     at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteConnection.acquirePreparedStatement(SQLiteConnection.java:1093)
                     at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteConnection.prepare(SQLiteConnection.java:670)
                     at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteSession.prepare(SQLiteSession.java:588)
                     at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteProgram.<init>(SQLiteProgram.java:59)
                     at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteQuery.<init>(SQLiteQuery.java:37)
                     at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDirectCursorDriver.query(SQLiteDirectCursorDriver.java:44)
                     at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase.rawQueryWithFactory(SQLiteDatabase.java:1454)
                     at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase.queryWithFactory(SQLiteDatabase.java:1301)
                     at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase.query(SQLiteDatabase.java:1172)
                     at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase.query(SQLiteDatabase.java:1378)
                     at com.orm.SugarRecord.find(SugarRecord.java:201)
                     at com.orm.SugarRecord.find(SugarRecord.java:187)
                     at openfoodfacts.github.scrachx.openfood.network.OpenFoodAPIClient$1.onResponse(OpenFoodAPIClient.java:109)
                     at retrofit2.ExecutorCallAdapterFactory$ExecutorCallbackCall$1$1.run(ExecutorCallAdapterFactory.java:66)
                     at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:739)
                     at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95)
                     at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:145)
                     at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:6938)
                     at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
                     at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:372)
                     at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:1404)
                     at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:1199)
```

The way I managed to fix it is to:
* clean application cache (on the phone)
* clean application data (on the phone)
* disable instant run in Android Studio ( as indicated by issues #134 and  #44 )

title: Add ingredient detection tab for Open Beauty Facts
label: [Label(name="Open Beauty Facts"), Label(name="api-update-required"), Label(name="very high impact")]
body:
Highlight potentially problematic ingredients for Open Beauty Facts

The Open Beauty Facts API detects ingredients:
http://world.openbeautyfacts.org/api/v0/product/3760179070262.json

currently we look for:
```
Without Parabens
Without Formaldehyde releasers
With Allergenic fragrances
Without Silicones
Without Phenoxyethanol
Without Triclosan
Without Cetrimonium bromide
With Methylisothiazolinone
Without Aluminum salts
```

If they are here, their english slug will be present eg:
```
en:allergenic-fragrances
```

Once we do the same for Open Food Facts server side, we'll be able to use it there as well.

title: Cities where bought is in fact the city associated with the packager code
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="priority"), Label(name="product browsing"), Label(name="very high impact")]
body:
**ISSUE:**"`Cities where bought:`" displays the city where the product was packaged.`Amiens`
**SOLUTION:** It should display "`Packager code :` " with the Raw value of the packager code (`FR 45.533.33 CE` or `EMB 54365`) and then the city name currently displayed.
**Example:**`FR 45.533.33 CE - Amiens`

"`Country where sold:`" actually contains the city AFAIK ("`City, state and country where purchased`" in the web version)

title: WearOS (formerly Android Wear) support
label: [Label(name="long term")]
body:
NB: This is a feature to implement later

Smartwatches don't have a camera to scan a barcode. 
To enable product lookup, we should reuse the search by barcode views (typing the barcode, digit by digit)
The product view also needs to be simplified and stretched down.

title: Ability to cast the product page and the graph page on TV
label: [Label(name="long term")]
body:
In the list of features to implement in a far future:
- ability to cast a product on the Large screen
- ability to cast the graph page (for product comparison), and move between dots using the phone

title: Add a "Do not display this again" checkbox on the popups

body:
- I'm getting "Please take a picture" popup whenever I add a product. 
- This is slowing down contribution. 
- Do it the Material design way with little dismissable card and kill popups alltogether

body: Create a secret mode (like Android Dev settings) for wildly experimental features

title: Change the wording of popup in offline mode
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="offline")]
body:
"The product doesn't exist" >> unless we have a local list of existing barcodes (and even so), we can't say that for sure.

In that case, say that we can't display the product while in offline mode and propose to add photos.

Or better yet:
- jump to an empty product page
- display the add photos button
-display below it a  "more information if available, when you get a connexion again" text
-display below that a "reload page"

title: Can't upload offline products
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="offline")]
body:
I have ten offline products to upload, and it makes in the app crash.

- they don't have a name, quantity or store
- some of them don't have all three images
- some of them might already be in the database

We need to ensure that:
- we can send, even without  a name, quantity or store
- we can send, even without all the images
- if already in the database, add as additional images

title: use a Search view for search product by name or by barcode
label: [Label(name="feature")]
body:
Currently the user has to open the drawer, then click on `search by name` or `search by barcode`.
Then in the new fragment the user fill the input and click on the validate button.

Why not insert a menu item on the home screen and attach on it a [search view](https://developer.android.com/training/search/setup.html) ?

we could search a product but also any kind of content like ingredients, allergens etc
We could also show during the search the history of the user.

I took an example with the `Inbox` app which as a great search behavior:

![](http://img.talkandroid.com/uploads/2014/10/Google_Inbox_App_Screenshot_02.png)
![](http://www.androidpolice.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/nexus2cee_InboxSearchUI.png)

body: do not show the menu if no history items

body:

currently we have country codes that most people won't understand.

title: Send text info to shopping list apps
label: [Label(name="feature"), Label(name="sharing")]
body: Apparently the link button can send a link to OFF to any app that accepts images or text; even to the gallery, which receives a QR code image.  [OI Shopping List](https://f-droid.org/repository/browse/?fdfilter=shopping&fdid=org.openintents.shopping) also receives a link, which is not useful.  It would be useful to send to it something like the TITLE - BRAND - QTY you see in OFF's lists.

title: Provide app shortcuts for Nougat
label: [Label(name="Nougat"), Label(name="feature")]
body:
App shortcuts API  lets you surface key actions directly in the launcher and take your users deep into your app instantly. You can create up to 5 shortcuts, either statically or dynamically.

possible ones:
- Scan
- Search by name
- Search by barcode
- History
- My contributions
https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/shortcuts.html

title: Nutritional info #97
label: [Label(name="easy fix"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Fixed https://github.com/openfoodfacts/OpenFoodFacts-androidApp/issues/97.
Changed the order of nutritions in the products nutrition information screen.
Created a method which replaces the nutrition level string from the api with the corresponding localized value.
Added a localisation in German (my native language) and French (copied from the website, so might be not correct in this context).

Move ingredient picture to ingredient tab, nutrition picture to nutrition tab

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bookland

body:
Open the edition page in a Chrome Custom Tab within the app on devices where it is possible.

https://developer.chrome.com/multidevice/android/customtabs

This enables to avoid leaving the app and we get automatic login if the user has already used Open Food Facts on the web.

title: Use new HTTPS api fix #112
body:
Use new HTTPS api
fix #112

title: fix/149
body: fix #149

title: code refactoring - lint errors
body:
make abstract the two activities which are not declared on the manifest file
remove useless parent layout
move some resource types (arrays, styles and strings)
apply some others android & Java lint issues

title: use Product instead of State in the bundle intent used in ProductFragment
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Currently we put the all State object in the bundle intent, which is used in the 3 product fragments and in the product activity.
Whereas in those fragments, we only use the product (`state.getProduct`); so it should be more efficient to only add the product in the bundle.

Also `additionalProperties` field in the State class seems useless.

title: fix NPE
body:
fix NPE
fix #150

title: Addictives came from files not from API
body:
Addictives files (english and french) came from the filesystem.
Why not fetch the Open food API ? cf http://world.openfoodfacts.org/additives.json

We also fetch both english and French during the first launch of the application; why not fetch only the locale one ?

title: Support App Indexing
label: [Label(name="feature")]
body:
The power of the web version of Open Food Facts is the huge amount of pages available.

Enabling app indexing will allow people to discover the app organically.

https://firebase.google.com/docs/app-indexing/
https://firebase.google.com/docs/app-indexing/android/app

title: external API URL
body:
external API URL of open food facts in res/values/strings.xml
fix #113

Why the default Open Food Facts Android App is still the old one ? and not built from this project

increase the maximum heap size for the Gradle daemon to 4608 MB

title: [Suggestion] Use hosted.weblate.org as translation system
label: [Label(name="translations")]
body: You can add your project for free to weblate https://hosted.weblate.org/ and get translations and verification of translations in many languages from contributors all over the world. Making fixes and/or adding new languages is automated by weblate. Please consider doing it :)

title: Add ability to display an Open Beauty Facts product
label: [Label(name="Open Beauty Facts"), Label(name="feature")]
body:
There are a couple of changes with Open Beauty Facts:
- the API url is openbeautyfacts.org instead of openfoodfacts.org
- hide nutrition facts
- add period after opening
- add ingredient analysis
- the taxonomies are not the same

title: remove jackson errors during the startup of the application
body: remove jackson errors during the startup of the application

title: To run dex in process, the Gradle daemon needs a larger heap.
body:
```


:app:compileReleaseNdk UP-TO-DATE
:app:compileReleaseSources
:app:lintVitalRelease
:app:mergeReleaseShaders
:app:compileReleaseShaders
:app:generateReleaseAssets
:app:mergeReleaseAssets
:app:transformClassesWithJarMergingForRelease
:app:collectReleaseMultiDexComponents
:app:transformClassesWithMultidexlistForRelease
:app:transformClassesWithDexForRelease
Running dex as a separate process.
To run dex in process, the Gradle daemon needs a larger heap.
It currently has 2048 MB.
For faster builds, increase the maximum heap size for the Gradle daemon to at least 4608 MB (based on the dexOptions.javaMaxHeapSize = 4g).
To do this set org.gradle.jvmargs=-Xmx4608M in the project gradle.properties.
For more information see https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/build_environment.html
:app:transformClassesWithDexForRelease FAILED
FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.
* What went wrong:
Execution failed for task ':app:transformClassesWithDexForRelease'.
> com.android.build.api.transform.TransformException: com.android.ide.common.process.ProcessException: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
* Try:
Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace. Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.
BUILD FAILED
Total time: 2 mins 4.591 secs
The command "./gradlew build connectedCheck" exited with 1.
Done. Your build exited with 1.

```

title: Jackson improvements
body:
refactor all model class to remove useless jackson annotations
Create a Json Utils class to use a shared ObjectMapper ([performance](http://wiki.fasterxml.com/JacksonBestPracticesPerformance))
Optimize json reading
add some unit tests
