title: Crash when accessing the product 3502110004253
body:
The app crash when accessing the product http://world.openfoodfacts.org/product/3502110004253/tropicana-pure-premium-reveil-gourmand either via name search, codebar search or codebar scan.
It's juice sold in France.
The very similar product http://world.openfoodfacts.org/product/3502110003652/reveil-fruite-pure-premium-tropicana on the other hand is fine, no crash.
The app is in french. Got it from F-Droid two days ago (0.2.4)

title: Added way to check if an application is installed on a device
body: Added the ability to check if an application is installed on a device. Allows the ability to promote the Open Beauty Facts application through the Open Food Facts application only if Open Beauty Facts is not installed on the device. If it is installed, do not promote the application to the user.

title: Try to find the product in Open Beauty Facts before proposing to add it
label: [Label(name="Open Beauty Facts"), Label(name="feature")]
body:
Use the Open Beauty Facts API to see if the barcode is present is Open Beauty Facts.
It it is present, display it, with a promo to install the Open Beauty Facts app
If it is not present, display the regular product addition screen

title: Offer to change contribution language based on location of pictures
label: [Label(name="multilingual products"), Label(name="product addition")]
body: Read the EXIF from the photos, and offer appropriate language based on that.

title: Continuous barcode scanning (with snippet)
label: [Label(name="feature"), Label(name="power users"), Label(name="scanning")]
body:
Continuous barcode scanning

The app keeps looking for new barcodes until the back button is pressed (as coded here)
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/15892461/how-to-trigger-bulk-mode-scan-in-zxing

In our case, instead of saving to CSV, it should display something like this:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1689815/17096229/ac0cf1f4-5258-11e6-93f9-00e8204c860b.png)

title: Add option to start scan on app open
body: Add option to start directly on the scanner view on app open

title: Choose language when adding a new product
label: [Label(name="feature"), Label(name="very high impact")]
body:
When adding a new product with the app, it seems the default langage for the product is english and we can't choose it. So if I add a french product, when I want to edit it on the website, its main langage is english, and I have to reupload the images as french, because elsewhere they don't appear on the product page.

So we shoud be able to choose the language when adding a new product, and we could add a default language in the settings for example.

title: Detect barcode at 90
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="scanning")]
body:
Moodstocks enabled barcode scanning even when rotated 90.
The scanner needs to do that as well.

title: Better photo flow for power users
label: [Label(name="feature")]
body:
Power contributors want to quicky scan products in a supermarket to see which one are not in the database.
A power mode where the barcode scanner : 
- would keep scanning if the product is present 
- just overlay for 5 sec a green tick and the date of the most recent photo (if the product is present)
- overlay a button to take photos (with the same viewfinder) that would automatically be added to the last scanned product  (in any case)

title: Ability to add a product that doesn't have a barcode
label: [Label(name="api-update-required"), Label(name="feature"), Label(name="product addition")]
body:
It's actually possible on the web version to add a product without a barcode. We should investigate how to do that on mobile.
poke @stephanegigandet

title: Automatic background removal from images
label: [Label(name="feature")]
body:
Don't know if it's possible, but being able to remove background from images would be cool. 
Ideas:
- Either automatically based on movement as the photo is being taken
- using a slider after the photo has been taken

Stuff that I have found:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/29064395/background-removal-from-images

Creating a view listing all scanned products.

title: Unit added when uploading images of a product
body:
When uploading a product without adding any information (only images), the unit is added.

example:http://world.openbeautyfacts.org/product/3600550454048

That is making a wrong assumption. It could be L, kg or anything. Let's avoid setting a unit unless the user explicitely does so.

title: Login issues
label: [Label(name="login")]
body:
I found two issues in the login process:
- When identifying in the app, if I try with any login (even a random one) and no password, I get a green notification to let me know I'm connected, which makes no sense. Logically, if I give a login, I should give a password as well. 
- After logging in, when I look in the left menu, the login isn't updated (this is the case with a real login / pwd as well). I have to exit with the return button and launch the app again to see the new login in the left drawer.

title: Setting to change default contribution language
label: [Label(name="feature"), Label(name="multilingual products"), Label(name="settings")]
body:
By default, the contribution country and language is the UX language and/or the detected IP.

Sometimes, it makes sense to contribute in a specific language, from a specific country.

Add a toggle in settings to be able to choose the default contribution language and country.

Poke @stephanegigandet

title: Toggle to change interface language
label: [Label(name="easy fix")]
body:
- We support languages not yet in Android
- We want to showcase that Open Food Facts is a global project

Let the user change the OFF interface language in settings.

title: Display full nutrition table
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="feature"), Label(name="priority")]
body: Something like: calcium, iron, proteins (what amino acids), vitamins (A, C, ), omega (3, 6,), etc

title: Hide empty fields
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="product browsing")]
body:
Empty fields shouldn't be visible : packaging, categories, traces, additives etc often display "null" or an empty field, they should be hidden instead. 
In the nutrition page, an indication should be present saying a given nutritional info is not indicated, or if they aren't available for the product (when "Nutrition facts are not specified on the product") instead of "nullnull" everywhere.

title: Nutritional info
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
In the app, the nutritional info are displayed in this order : 
- Salt, Fat, Sugar, Saturated fat

Whereas on the website it's : 
- Fat, Saturated fat, Sugar, Salt

To be consistent and easier to read, it should be the same as on the website.

And the text next to the colored circles is a mix between english and french (for me). By example:
- Sel : moderate
- Matires grasses / Lipides : moderate
- Sucres : low
- Acides gras saturs : high

The terms moderate, low etc. should be translated.

title: Products causing allergies
body:
If in the ingredients there are multiple of the same type, they all repeat in this box.

Expected behavior: There should be a distinct applied and only one of each type of allergy should be visible.
Sorted by first occurrence (biggest dosage), frequency or by name.

title: Ingredients list formatting
body:
Allergens marked such as "_soy_" are not formatted consistently with the website.
Expected behavior: "soy" should be in bold.

title: Bad translation
Allergens not displayed properly in the ingredients
body: In the ingredients list, the allergens are displayed between "_" (underscore), but the words should be in bold, like on the website.

title: Bug when scanning with network connection deactivated
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
When scanning a product with the network deactivated, the app displays a popup stating that there is a network error, but asks at the same time if you want to add a new product, whereas it couln't even know if it's already existing.

I had no data connection activated and was in plane mode so the app shouldn't even try to search the product in the database.

title: (Meta bug) Improve the allergen list
label: [Label(name="allergens"), Label(name="ux")]
body:
Currently, the allergens list used to set an alert is huge, and seems like a random list of almost all ingredients. It's not practical at all and suffers from a few issues, I have a few ideas that could be useful :
- sort the items alphabetically
- add a search field : the user enters a few letters, and the corresponding items appear in a list
- language : the list uses french items (at least for me), and once added, the allergens use english terms. Moreover the connexion between french and english terms is wrong : "Mozarella" is not "gluten", "Vin" isn't "mustard" etc...
- maybe only keep useful items, I'm not sure the hole list is relevant as it is huge
- performance improvements : currently on my phone the list takes 3-4 seconds to appear (may be related to previous point), even if displayed more than once in a row. The data is apparently stored locally, so I find this very slow.

Thanks for reading me and have a good day :)

title: Crash when entering offline edition mode
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Hi, first of all, this is the first time I participate in reporting issues in this project, so thank you for this app :)

There is the issue : the app instantly crashes when I enter the offline edition mode. Since a few weeks I have the app, each time I tried, I encountered this problem, but it doesn't seem reported yet. 

It only says (in french) "Open Food s'est arrt" (Open Food stopped working) with a button to send a report, what I did a few times. For information I have Android 5.0.2 on a HTC One (M7).

Thanks.

title: Button to add new languages to existing products.
label: [Label(name="editing"), Label(name="feature"), Label(name="multilingual products")]
body:
Now that both Open Food and Open Beauty support multilingual products, it has to be super easy to add new languages to an existing products.

It has to be possible to add different languages for:
- product name
- common name
- ingredients

possibly with a favorite language system to save time, or with a dropdown menu otherwise.

title: Dropdown to choose the language for ingredient/nutrition/front pictures
label: [Label(name="feature"), Label(name="multilingual products")]
body:
Now that both Open Food and Open Beauty support multilingual products, it has to be super easy to send pictures in several languages.

It has to be possible to choose the language for ingredient/nutrition/front pictures, and to upload them for several languages (possibly with a favorite language system)

title: automatic update for FDroid
body: @krt16s @LuccoJ Is it possible to set an automatic update for FDroid ?

title: Fields for which we have no data should not be shown (avoid displaying "null" as the value)
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: In the ingredients and nutrition tabs, if a product does not have data for some fields, then the value is shown as "null". For nutrition it becomes concatenated as "null (nullnull)"

title: Display product images without changing their aspect ratio
body: The swipable images carrousel is a very interesting idea, but since OFF images have different aspect ratios, the images end up being shrinked or enlarged. e.g. a Coke cans becomes wider than its height.

title: Add alert button not working
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: When I got to the "Allergen  alerts" and click on the + icon, I get a dialog with just "Add alert" and nothing else.

title: Product pictures and data should be sent to the OFF server immediately if the network is available
body:
By default, when users click on "Save", if the app sees that the network connection is available, it should send the data immediately instead of saving it locally. If the data upload fails, then save locally.

In fact I would even prefer the data to be uploaded even if the user does not click save, especially the pictures. (that's what the current OFF app does)

title: Ask users to submit multiple photos for product, ingredients and nutrition facts table
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Currently there's a button "Take a picture" (in French "Prenez une photo"). Some users may think we just need one picture.

I suggest we had a message above the button that says "Please take a picture of the product, ingredients, nutrition facts table and any other information on the label. Thank you!"

title: Remove "Store" from input fields, add "Brands"
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="priority")]
body:
The "Store" field is not very important, we should prioritize which input field we display:
- Product name
- Brands
- Quantity
- ...

title: Scanning should be silent by default
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: When the barcode is successfully scanned, my phone whistles. I think it would be best to not make any noise (especially for stores) by default, and perhaps allow users to turn on an audio notification for successful scans. (in which case a short "beep" like the one cashiers have in store would probably be enough)

title: Change name of log in field from "Save" to "Log in" / "Sign in"
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: When I enter my OFF user name and password, the button below is "SAUVEGARDER", it should be "SE CONNECTER" or "S'IDENTIFIER".

title: "Send all" button in offline edition does nothing, images and data not sent
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="priority")]
body:
Related to bug #69:

I have a few images and some data for one product that I saved and that I'm not trying to upload to the server.

When I tap on "Tout envoyer", absolutely nothing happens. The product stays there, the button does not change (e.g. it doesn't change color to show that it has been pressed).

title: Add a comment that the edit was made with the new Android app
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: `comment=added%20with%20the%20new%20Android%20app`

title: Add a "Edit on web" button on product pages
label: [Label(name="feature")]
body: Add a temporary "Edit on web" button on product pages until we have native product editing in the app.

title: Cannot add picture in some cases
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="local-database"), Label(name="priority")]
body:
When adding a new product, sometimes the app won't use the picture I take with camera. I choose Take Picture, the camera opens, I take a picture, the buttons Verwerfen (Discard) and Speichern (Save) appear, I click Save, the OpenFood data entry mask reappears, but no photo is attached. I can try Take Picture again, but often this will still fail just like before.

This might be related to screen orientation: if I rotate the phone so that the left long side is down (so that the camera goes into widescreen, and the Discard/Save buttons are displayed on the left long side of the screen), it usually works fine (taken pictures are visible in the data entry mask). In any other orientation it usually fails.

This is on Samsung S4 Mini, with Android 4.4.2, OpenFood 0.1.12 (from F-Droid), and Kamera (com.sec.android.app.camera) 2.0.

title: Better handling of upload problems
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="in progress"), Label(name="priority")]
body:
[This is a bit of a rant - sorry]

I have installed Open Food 0.1.12 from F-Droid, and was pleasantly surprised when it first found some articles I had and when it then allowed me to anonymously submit info for missing articles.
However, taking pictures was a real PITA (I might make a separate issue report for that); but much more frustrating was that half of the painstakingly taken pictures were lost during upload.

I have added three products. For every product I have added three pictures (main, ingredients, nutrition). Of these nine pictures I now see a total of four pictures at de.openfoodfacts.org; apparently the other five have been lost during upload. That's really frustrating, especially since the entries are gone from my Offline Edit list, so I can't even retry these uploads.

In two cases OpenFood told me about Internet Connectivity issues. In one case this might have been correct since I was a bit far from Wifi hotspot; in another case I took care to be close the hotspot, but the app still complained and lost one picture. In the third case (probably the one where no images were uploaded at all) the app was halted with an error: when it reappeared, one of the products was gone from the Offline Edits lisrt, and none of its images was uploaded.

This makes for a really really frustrating user experience. So I mainly would suggest to keep offline edits in the list and to allow users to retry their uploads. Maybe even allow a re-upload if the upload was successful - while this might be complicated on server-side, I would feel much more in control, rather than having the app just remove my entered data.

title: Speech synthesis of food data
label: [Label(name="feature"), Label(name="priority"), Label(name="product browsing")]
body:
The application could be used as an accessibility aid for people who can't easily read the (usually very small) ingredient lists or other data on food labels.
This possibility would be enabled, or at least improved, if the app had support for speaking out ingredients and other data after scanning a barcode, using Android's TTS API in the appropriate language.

title: Add more images to existing products
label: [Label(name="feature"), Label(name="in progress"), Label(name="priority"), Label(name="very high impact")]
body:
Add a button on the product page to add fresher or missing images to an existing product.
Here's a mockup of how it would ideally work: a button on each tab, with a language dropdown. It allows the user to direct an image to a function (ingredient/nutrition/front) and a language (product can have up to 20 languages)

The current photo of the ingredients (for example) would be display, or an informative text (There is no photo of ingredients in French)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1689815/19220072/cd7caca0-8e24-11e6-967a-0a00fad94af6.png)

A button in each tab to add a photo if no picture is available 
- one in the main tab for the front image and additional images
- one button for the ingredient photo
- one for the nutrition photo

Behaviour: 
- if a front/ingredients/nutrition image is already selected for this language, show "Add more images" and upload images without selecting them
- if no front/ingredients/nutrition image is selected for this language, show "Add images" and upload images without selecting them (the server will do the job)

title: Fix depdencies
body:
Highest version for 21.x support libs is 21.0.3, not 21.1.1.

Material-dialogs is no longer in jcenter, but only in jitpack. First replace it with 

```
compile('com.github.afollestad.material-dialogs:commons:0.8.5.7@aar') {
transitive = true
}
```

and you have to add jitpack to the allprojects repo list.

Also it would be good to pull as much dependecies from central repos and dont use jar files at all.

probably retrying (with a message letting the user know it is retrying)
or providing a way to retry (like a button),
or simply going forward with adding the product  are
